finding: The SNP rs8042149 was identified in a GWAS conducted by the PGC-PTSD, which found significant genetic correlations relevant to PTSD, indicating its role in the genetic architecture of this disorder.
title: Leveraging large-scale genetics of PTSD and cardiovascular disease demonstrates robust shared risk and improves risk prediction accuracy

finding: The intronic variant rs7183859 in THSD4 showed significant ancestry-correlated heterogeneity in effect size estimates, particularly larger effects in non-EUR ancestries including African ancestries. It had a Bonferroni-corrected P value of 3.33×10^-5, indicating its relevance in the context of lung function.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The variant rs59646751, located near IGF1R, had a P value of 2.4 x 10^-4 in the European cohort and was significantly associated with insulin resistance in a multi-ancestry study, highlighting its relation to the Hyper Insulin cluster.
title: Multi-ancestry Polygenic Mechanisms of Type 2 Diabetes Elucidate Disease Processes and Clinical Heterogeneity

finding: The variant rs4887091 was identified within a super chromatin interactome that modulated a CTCF binding site, suggesting it could drive broader chromatin changes and influence gene regulation in coronary artery disease (CAD).
title: Single cell variant to enhancer to gene map for coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs7182567 was found to be an SMC-specific caQTL associated with the expression of the gene ADAMTS7 in the tibial artery and had a significant p-value (5.4×10^-26), indicating a strong association with CAD.
title: Single cell variant to enhancer to gene map for coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs12916774 was identified as associated with femur neck and total BMD, with significant evidence supporting CHSY1 as a candidate gene at this locus.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs2414098 was identified as a male-specific locus near the CYP19A1 gene, indicating its differentiated impact on BMD between genders.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs3784491 was found to have low LD with rs12916774 but was noted for its marginal significance in largest-scale GWAS, suggesting ongoing investigation is warranted.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: Located ~6kb from the 5' end of CHRNA5, rs2036527 was associated with cigarettes per day in a study of 32,389 African-American individuals, establishing its role in smoking behavior.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: This variant was previously described as associated with smoking trajectory contrast I in a trans-ethnic meta-analysis, indicating its role in different smoking behavior patterns.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: In PheWAS analysis for European individuals, rs11634974 was associated with current tobacco smoking, confirming its relevance to smoking behavior.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: Found significant in PheWAS analysis, rs11636198 was associated with current tobacco smoking and various other traits, supporting its implication in smoking behavior.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: It showed associations in PheWAS with current tobacco smoking in European individuals, affirming its linkage to smoking behavior.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: The minor T-allele at rs2472297 was associated with a lower intake of cereal (beta=-0.059, 95% CIs=[-0.074, -0.044], P=4.38E-15) and a higher intake of coffee (beta=0.142, 95% CIs=[0.131, 0.152], P=4.20E-155). The association with higher BMI, total cholesterol, and LDL cholesterol was mediated by increased coffee intake, highlighting its possible role in influencing dietary habits and metabolic traits.
title: Increased brain volume from higher cereal and lower coffee intake: Shared genetic determinants and impacts on cognition and metabolism

finding: a missense variant in CHRNA5 that significantly influenced tobacco use with a p-value of 2.79e-175.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP rs4702 located at the FURIN locus was identified as a lead variant shared between OUD, SCZ, BD, and MD. It indicated a strong genetic relationship among the disorders, validating its relevance to the neurobiological pathways involved.
title: Genome-wide analyses reveal novel opioid use disorder loci and genetic overlap with schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and major depression

finding: The SNP rs17565841 located at OCA2 was identified as one of the top 10 SNPs connected to 'slow' PD progression, with the risk being correlated with its non-reference allele.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The rs117618017 variant near the APH1B gene showed a significant association with longevity, suggesting an important role in longevity-related pathways.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: SNP rs11070995 was linked to EGFR expression in TNBC. This SNP's allelic variation was shown to impact the expression levels of EGFR, affecting treatment response and disease-free survival among patients, as those with specific genotypes experienced poorer outcomes.
title: Molecular Profiling of a Triple-negative Breast Cancer Cohort in India for EGFR and AR expression analyzed for patient outcomes showed a distinct subset of cellular co-expression

finding: The minor T-allele at rs2472297 was associated with lower intake of cereal (regression coefficient -0.059, P=4.38E-15) and higher intake of coffee (regression coefficient 0.142, P=4.20E-155). This association reinforced the negative genetic correlation between cereal and coffee intake.
title: Increased brain volume from cereal, decreased brain volume from coffee -- shared genetic determinants and impacts on cognitive function, body mass index (BMI) and other metabolic measures: cohort study of UK Biobank participants

finding: Carriers of the rs877087 T allele in RYR3 had an increased risk of heart failure (HR 1.13, p=0.02). The population incidence of heart failure could have decreased by 9.2% if these carriers were prescribed alternatives avoiding their genotype's negative impact.
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: This SNP was prioritized for MFGE8, implicated in vascular smooth muscle cell proliferation and CAD pathogenesis, representing a new CAD association.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: This SNP was associated with CAD at the LIPC gene locus, where it was observed to cause higher HDL-cholesterol levels, presenting an inverse relation to traditional findings.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The SNP rs1005752 in HMG20A was associated with late T2D diagnosis, indicating its relevance in the later progression of the disease.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs2472297, located in the CYP1A2 gene region, was positively associated with fasting plasma caffeine levels in a meta-analysis of 9,876 European ancestry participants. This finding indicated that genetic variants influencing caffeine metabolism were directly relevant to assessing the effects of caffeine on body mass index (BMI). Specifically, the study highlighted how metabolism-related variants can lead to differences in caffeine consumption behavior and consequently affect BMI.
title: Comparison of caffeine consumption behavior with plasma caffeine levels as exposures in drug-target Mendelian randomization and implications for interpreting effects on obesity

finding: The rs17514846-A variant in the FURIN gene showed a genome-wide significant association with OA, with a p-value of 8.82 × 10^-7 and indicated a link to gene expression.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study of opioid addiction: OPRM1 and Beyond

finding: The SNP <italic>rs1426654</italic> was associated with skin pigmentation traits, showcasing significant genetic variability across populations.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: rs10046 within <italic>CYP19A1</italic> was found to have the same direction of association in both GRaD and ALSPAC cohorts, suggesting its relevance to reading performance.
title: Genetic and Demographic Predictors of Latent Reading Ability in Two Cohorts

finding: rs77641439 within <italic>DNAAF4</italic> was positively associated in both cohorts, indicating its importance in reading ability.
title: Genetic and Demographic Predictors of Latent Reading Ability in Two Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs7183733, a primary cis-pQTL for CA12 identified in the deCODE study, was discovered to be associated with the characteristic of dentures, with an odds ratio of 1.12 and a p-value of 5.59e-12. This finding suggested a case of vertical pleiotropy, indicating that higher CA12 levels impacted the likelihood of requiring dentures.
title: Identification of therapeutic targets for 16 clinical diseases by integrating human plasma proteome with genome

finding: This SNP influenced PPCDC, required for coenzyme A biosynthesis, showcasing an increasing effect on protein levels.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: The rs877087 T allele in the RYR3 gene was found to modestly increase heart failure risks among dihydropiridine CCB patients, with an overall HR of 1.13 (95% CI 1.02-1.25). In subsets with high polygenic scores for body fat mass, lean mass, and lipoprotein A, the heart failure risk estimates increased significantly, highlighting a relationship between this SNP and heart failure outcomes in CCB users.
title: Combining pharmacogenetics and patient characteristic polygenic scores to improve outcome prediction for Calcium Channel Blocker treatment

finding: The PLIN1 p.L90P variant (rs139271800) was associated with beneficial effects on WHR_adjBMI and increased gluteofemoral fat mass, marking it as an original finding in the context of fat distribution.
title: Identification of rare loss of function variation regulating body fat distribution

finding: The PLIN1 p.T338DfsX51 variant (rs750619494) was associated with a lower WHR_adjBMI, reinforcing the beneficial role of PLIN1 in fat distribution.
title: Identification of rare loss of function variation regulating body fat distribution

finding: The analysis indicated that the rs16969968 genotype from the CHRNA5 gene was associated with a younger age at first birth in women and men who were never smokers. Specifically, this SNP was found to influence smoking behavior by reducing nicotine aversion, which consequently increased the number of cigarettes smoked per day. However, the effect on age of first birth was only evident in never smokers, suggesting potential pleiotropic effects.
title: Health behaviours prior to pregnancy and fertility outcomes: Triangulation of evidence in the Norwegian Mother, Father and Child Cohort Study (MoBa)

finding: The SNP rs2472297 found in the CYP1A1-CYP1A2 locus was associated with habitual coffee consumption and was validated in earlier studies.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs2667773 at the LOC101929457-LINGO1 locus was recognized for its association with increased coffee consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs12898397 was identified as a missense variant with a deleterious impact, associated with increased coffee consumption and decreased expression of ULK3.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs111395362 reached genome-wide significance in the RBS-R ritualistic GWAS with p = 7.7 × 10^-9. Although it did not map within 100 kb of any gene, it was approximately 500 kb downstream of SPATA8, a gene previously associated with conduct disorders in ADHD.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The SNP rs75957257 reached genome-wide significance in the RBS-R injurious GWAS with p = 2.3 × 10^-8. It did not map within 100 kb of any gene, but was approximately 200 kb upstream of SPATA8.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: SPPL2A:rs59685680-G variant was also indicated as protective in relation to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The SNP rs58349661 was identified as interacting with body mass index (BMI) in the association with colorectal cancer risk within the FMN1/GREM1 gene region. This finding was derived from an analysis conducted in the Genetics and Epidemiology of Colorectal Cancer Consortium (GECCO). It indicated that the genetic effects on colorectal cancer risk could be modified by environmental factors such as obesity, highlighting the importance of considering genetic and environmental interactions in the understanding of cancer development.
title: Adiposity and cancer: meta-analysis, mechanisms, and future perspectives

finding: The minor T-allele of SNP rs1079396 was associated with methylation levels at the SGK269 gene in SS patients, highlighting its potential role in altering DNA methylation states in the context of SS.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The minor G-allele of SNP rs7169481 was associated with increased DNA methylation at the ATP10A gene in SS patients, indicating a relevant epigenetic alteration that could play a role in disease susceptibility.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The SNP rs1261660572, positioned upstream of the ALDH1A2 gene, revealed a significant association with ITR in the study, presenting a p-value of 5.62x10^-7. The minor allele (CACAA) was found in 3.425% of cases compared to 25% in controls, leading to an odds ratio of 0.1064, which highlights its relevance to antidepressant efficacy.
title: Genomic predictors of response to antidepressants in Major depressive disorder (MDD): A GWAS-Based Study on Indian cohort

finding: The SNP rs35647788 was associated with TFS, attaining genome-wide significance. It showed consistent associations across stage I and stage II studies with hazard ratios of 4.76 and 3.12 respectively, indicating significantly reduced transplant-free survival for carriers of this variant. Additionally, this variant was located in an intron of the gene PCSK6, which was strongly expressed in IPF lung tissues.
title: PCSK6 and Survival in Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis

finding: The synonymous variant rs8040868 in the CHRNA5/A3/B4 gene cluster was associated with 0.25 attributable DALYs. This impact was observed mainly through consequences of smoking, contributing to conditions such as lung cancer and COPD, with a 95% confidence interval of 0.23-0.27 and a very significant P-value of 1.6×10^-95.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: The rs191156695 SNP, an inframe insertion in MFGE8, was linked to preventing 39.1 yearly population DALYs per 100,000 through reduced ischemic heart disease risk, with a HR of 0.80 and a significant P-value of 4.6×10^-29.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: The SNP rs8042059 was found to have allelic regulatory activity within a schizophrenia GWAS locus on chromosome 15. This MPRA-positive variant showed an identical direction of effects with eQTLs where the alternative allele (C) was associated with downregulation of CHRNA5, indicating its function in mediating gene expression related to schizophrenia.
title: Systematic investigation of allelic regulatory activity of schizophrenia-associated common variants

finding: The SNP rs11418931 exhibited significant MPRA allelic activity. However, it was not detected in eQTL analyses, indicating its unique regulatory role in the context of schizophrenia risk, especially in conjunction with its neighboring alleles tested.
title: Systematic investigation of allelic regulatory activity of schizophrenia-associated common variants

finding: The SNP rs12913832 was one of the four replicated loci associated with retinal D<sub>f</sub>. This locus was near the HERC2 gene and had a significant P-Value of 2.34 x 10<sup>-59</sup>, confirming its role in retinal vascular characteristics and potential links to eye-related conditions.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian randomization study implicates inflammaging biomarkers in retinal vasculature, cardiometabolic diseases and longevity

finding: The variant rs35717941, also associated with retinal D<sub>f</sub>, was located near the OCA2 gene. It had a significant association (P-Value = 1.20 x 10<sup>-11</sup>) and was related to pigmentation and multiple ocular conditions.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian randomization study implicates inflammaging biomarkers in retinal vasculature, cardiometabolic diseases and longevity

finding: This intronic variant in THSD4 was previously implicated in lung function, showing larger effect size estimates in non-EUR ancestries, particularly African ancestries.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: Exonic SNP rs11259953 was identified as significant, associated with the WHAMM gene, although its specific relevance to Kawasaki disease was speculative.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: Similar to rs11259953, rs11259954 was significant in its association with the WHAMM gene, which involved actin regulation but with unclear roles in Kawasaki disease.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: The variant rs4702, located in FURIN, was previously validated experimentally and was identified in this study as a candidate causal variant affecting multiple behavioral and psychiatric traits, including schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
title: Trans-ethnic eQTL meta-analysis of human brain reveals regulatory architecture and candidate causal variants for brain-related traits

finding: The variant rs117618017 was identified as a candidate causal variant increasing the risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD) by boosting the expression of APH1B, despite a lack of functional validation through amino acid change.
title: Trans-ethnic eQTL meta-analysis of human brain reveals regulatory architecture and candidate causal variants for brain-related traits

finding: The rs146381257 variant in ZNF106 was discovered to have a strong association with multiple primary cancers, with a particularly high frequency among individuals diagnosed with prostate cancer (33.3%), lung cancer (28.6%), and other cancer types. It had an odds ratio of 7.82 and a p-value of 3.45×10^-6.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The SNP rs2606345 was associated with a significant increase in the risk of community-acquired pneumonia (CAP) as indicated by an odds ratio (OR) of 1.49, suggesting that individuals carrying the risk allele (T) were more susceptible to CAP compared to healthy controls. Additionally, this variant was identified for the first time to correlate positively with COVID-19 mortality rates globally, especially in regions with higher frequencies of the risk allele, thereby linking genetic factors with infectious disease outcomes.
title: Human genetic factors associated with pneumonia susceptibility, a cue for COVID-19 mortality

finding: The SNP rs4646903 was found to act as a protective marker against CAP, presenting a lower odds ratio (OR) of 0.79. This finding indicated that individuals having the risk allele (C) were less likely to develop CAP when compared with healthy controls, thus contributing to a protective genetic profile in the context of pneumonia susceptibility.
title: Human genetic factors associated with pneumonia susceptibility, a cue for COVID-19 mortality

finding: The SNP rs1048943 was also associated with an increased risk of CAP, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.31. This result supported the hypothesis that certain alleles of CYP1A1 contribute to pneumonia susceptibility, reinforcing the need to consider genetic polymorphisms when assessing individual risks for pneumonia.
title: Human genetic factors associated with pneumonia susceptibility, a cue for COVID-19 mortality

finding: The rs121913502 SNP in IDH2 was significantly tied to reduced lifespan with a hazard ratio of 5.7 and a p-value of 1.0 x 10^-20.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The SNP rs7173743, situated in the intron of the MORF4L1 gene, was successfully replicated for heart failure with a P MTAG HF_R of 2.36×10^-4.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: This SNP was located in the CHRNA5 gene on chromosome 15 and showed a highly significant association with tobacco use disorder (TUD) with a p-value of 1.60E-17. It corroborated the role of nicotinic acetylcholine receptor genes in smoking-related traits, particularly associated with nicotine consumption.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: This SNP, identified within the CHRNA5 region on chromosome 15, was noted as a well-established functional missense polymorphism (D398N) with a p-value of 4.93E-11. It was recognized as critical for smoking-related traits, linking it to nicotine dependence.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The SLC28A1 variant was associated with 5,6-dihydrouridine levels, indicating its role in nucleoside transport.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The variant SORD was associated with ribitol levels, highlighting its role in polyol metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs62021480 was associated with pregnancy loss, demonstrating a significant odds ratio (OR = 3.29, P = 7.83×10^-11). It is located on chromosome 15 and encodes a synonymous variant affecting the TRMU gene, involved in mitochondrial tRNA modification, linking it to disease phenotypes.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: The SNP rs17762839, associated with OTUD7A, displayed significant association with endometriosis in the AMR meta-analysis, demonstrating a P-value of 1.72E-08.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: Part of the genetic landscape influencing cancer mechanisms, rs143001709 showed potential importance in the context of cancer studies.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The SNP rs55760279 was identified as significantly associated with knee pain, showing a primary GWAS p-value of 1.29 × 10^-14. However, it did not reach the replication threshold in the outside dataset. It is located in the ALDH1A2 gene, linked to retinoic acid biosynthesis, suggesting its role in cartilage maintenance and knee pain pathophysiology.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The male-specific SNP rs2899611 presented a significant association with knee pain during sex-stratified GWAS, showing a p-value of 2.77 × 10^-11, implicating it in the pathogenesis of knee pain primarily in males through its association with the ALDH1A2 gene.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The SNP rs2033939 at 15q14 was significantly associated with cortical thickness in the postcentral gyrus, with a p-value of 2.7×10^−15. This variant has been previously identified in three GWAS studies associated with the same region.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: SNP rs1080066, also at 15q14, was associated with cortical thickness in the postcentral gyrus with a p-value of 5.6×10^−15. This locus had been highlighted in two recent GWAS studies, where it was associated with cortical area in the precentral gyrus.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: The SNP rs12916774 was identified as associated with femur neck and femur total BMD, associated with the CHSY1 gene. The P-value for its association was recorded as 2.14×10^-9.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs768397327, an intronic variant in ADAMTSL3, was significantly associated with ASATadjBMI (P = 2.2 x 10^-17) and was near-perfectly linked to another variant that had shown association with various fat ratios.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs11856122, also in ADAMTSL3, demonstrated significant genetic correlation with bioelectrical impedance-derived fat ratios and was highlighted alongside rs768397327.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: This SNP exhibited significant allelic imbalance (FDR 9.11E-36) with a 2.2 fold increase in chromatin accessibility, implicating it as a regulatory element for KLF13 expression.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs4702 was associated with OCD risk and located in the 5' UTR of the FURIN gene, showing potential decreased expression linked to OCD and other psychiatric disorders.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies new loci associated with OCD

finding: The variant rs176647 related to fractional anisotropy of the posterior limb of the internal capsule, suggesting significant overlap between insomnia and sleep traits.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: rs10046 was replicated with the same direction of association in both cohorts, indicating its relevance to reading ability within the analyzed populations.
title: Genetic and Demographic Predictors of Latent Reading Ability in Two Cohorts

finding: This SNP was associated with reading ability in both cohorts and showed consistent directional findings.
title: Genetic and Demographic Predictors of Latent Reading Ability in Two Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs2472297, corresponding to the CYP1A1-CYP1A2 locus, was confirmed as part of previously discovered loci linked to coffee consumption, which supports its ongoing relevance in genetic analyses.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs2667773, corresponding to the LOC101929457-LINGO1 locus, was identified newly in this study as related to coffee consumption, marking it as a significant finding.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The missense variant rs12898397 was associated with increased coffee consumption as well as decreased expression of the ULK3 gene, which has implications for metabolic functions.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs17514846 was noted for its association with OUD, being one of the significant variants at the FURIN locus with a reported connection to cardiovascular outcomes. It was associated with OUD at a p-value of 6.00×10⁻⁸ in the cross-ancestry analysis, just falling below the GWS threshold.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: The rs16969968 SNP, which relates to the alpha 5 nicotinic acetylcholine receptor gene (CHRNA5), was found to be associated with smoking behaviors including cigarettes per day (CPD) and cessation outcomes. In a trial involving predominantly African American participants, those with the higher risk genotypes (GA/AA) achieved greater abstinence with varenicline compared to placebo, while individuals with the low risk genotype (GG) had better outcomes with combined Nicotine Replacement Therapy (cNRT) compared to placebo. This finding pointed towards a significant genotype-by-treatment interaction, emphasizing the utility of this biomarker in precision cessation therapy.
title: Smoking, race, ancestry and prospective abstinence

finding: This SNP was identified intronic of C15orf41 with a meta-analysis P-value of 3.03×10^-4, indicating a new association with AD.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals new Alzheimer’s disease-associated rare variants in loci related to synaptic function and neuronal development

finding: Also intronic in C15orf41, this SNP further supported the association with AD with a meta-analysis P-value of 3.03×10^-4, confirming its relevance in AD pathology.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals new Alzheimer’s disease-associated rare variants in loci related to synaptic function and neuronal development

finding: This SNP was associated with overall lung cancer in multi-ancestry analyses, providing additional evidence of its role in lung cancer susceptibility.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: This low frequency variant was identified to increase MYO5C gene expression and to confer protection against type 2 diabetes, representing a novel co-localization.
title: Identification of novel type 1 and type 2 diabetes genes by co-localization of human islet eQTL and GWAS variants with colocRedRibbon

finding: The protective allele A of this variant was associated with lower CTSH expression and a lower odds ratio for type 1 diabetes, indicating it could have regulatory implications.
title: Identification of novel type 1 and type 2 diabetes genes by co-localization of human islet eQTL and GWAS variants with colocRedRibbon

finding: This SNP, located in the LIPC gene, displayed robust colocalization with FA traits, highlighting its potential causal role in lipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Connected with potential causal associations for FA traits; included in the broader analysis of lipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: This SNP in the 3' UTR of the gene FURIN was identified as a putative causal variant for SCZ, with cross-population relevance, although it did not achieve significance in the EAS population.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: SNP rs17601876 displayed a noteworthy significance with a p-value of 3.07×10^-14, linking it to endometrial cancer.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The rs12913832 SNP, located in the HERC2 gene, showed a strong association with retinal pigmentation and was implicated in influencing melanin production and iris color. Specifically, it affected chromatin-loop formation between a long-range enhancer and the OCA2 promoter, leading to decreased expression of OCA2 and lighter pigmentation. In the context of the study, individuals with the minor allele had increased likelihood of false positives for age-related macular degeneration (AMD).
title: Ethnicity is not biology: retinal pigment score to evaluate biological variability from ophthalmic imaging using machine learning

finding: Observed within the ALDH1A2 gene on chromosome 15, the SNP rs55760279 had a significant association with knee pain, indicated by a p-value of 1.29 × 10^-14. It was recognized for its role in retinoic acid biosynthesis, which is crucial for cartilage health.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The male-specific SNP rs2899611 demonstrated a strong association with knee pain and a p-value of 2.77 × 10^-11, pointing towards distinct genetic mechanisms in males.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: For asthma, rs11071559 in the RORA gene was significantly associated in the liability method but not observed in the binary method, corroborating literature claims.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The rs74653330 SNP, corresponding to the OCA2:c.1327G>A (p.Val443Ile) variant, demonstrated a synergistic effect in increasing the likelihood of a diagnosis of albinism when present alongside the TYR variant. This conclusion was supported by additional analyses in an independent cohort from the UK Biobank.
title: The co-occurrence of genetic variants in the TYR and OCA2 genes confers susceptibility to albinism

finding: The SNP rs1800411, which is a variant c.1551C>T located in exon 15, was linked to distinguishing maternal or paternal inheritance in Family 1. The analysis revealed all RT-PCR products with exon 10 skipped were expressed from the maternal allele carrying the variant c.1080C>T, confirming its significance in the context of OCA2 mis-splicing and potential pathogenesis.
title: Unsuspected consequences of synonymous and missense variants in OCA2 can be detected in blood cell RNA samples of patients with albinism

finding: Located in the gene FADS2, this SNP was also significantly associated with blood pressure-related phospholipids and exhibited relations to metabolic traits such as triglycerides and obesity-related measures.
title: A multi-omics study of circulating phospholipid markers of blood pressure

finding: This SNP was found within the ALDH1A2 gene and demonstrated significant associations with blood pressure-related phospholipids, linking it to traits affecting metabolic processes.
title: A multi-omics study of circulating phospholipid markers of blood pressure

finding: Associated with blood pressure-related phospholipids, rs12439649 was linked to LIPC gene and showed correlations with diverse traits in the metabolic domain, including those connected to cardiovascular health.
title: A multi-omics study of circulating phospholipid markers of blood pressure

finding: This SNP was identified as a putative causal variant for schizophrenia located in the 3' UTR of the FURIN gene. Although it did not reach genome-wide significance in the EAS population, its causal role was supported by shared implications across populations.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: The SNP rs35828350 was associated with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and was found to downregulate the Wdr73 gene in the adult cortex. This association was significant following the FDR regression analysis, indicating it played a notable role in the pathogenesis of ASD.
title: Discovering additional genetic loci associated with six psychiatric disorders/traits via FDR regression model leveraging external genetic and biological data

finding: The lead SNP rs4776579 was found within a unique locus on chromosome 15, linked to endophenotype T2:66. It was associated with prominent brain structures including planum temporale, Heschl's gyrus, and the brainstem. Like rs6868292, this variant had not been previously associated with brain-related traits by GWAS.
title: New phenotype discovery method by unsupervised deep representation learning empowers genetic association studies of brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs1051730 on chromosome 15 was found to be associated with smoking cessation during pregnancy and smoking quantity, as indicated by research from Freathy et al. This SNP was linked to increased smoking heaviness among carriers but was not associated with the initiation of smoking. Thus, mothers with the rs1051730 risk allele were not more likely to smoke than mothers without the allele. However, among those who did smoke, those who carried the allele found it harder to quit. This suggests that rs1051730 could moderate the impact of smoking on offspring birth weight.
title: Exploring and accounting for genetically driven effect heterogeneity in Mendelian Randomization

finding: The SNP rs12916774 was genome-wide significantly associated with femur neck BMD (P-value = 2.14 × 10^-9) and was identified based on novel findings in this study.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The male-specific locus rs2414098 on chromosome 15 showed a significant effect size in the male population for leg BMD, establishing a male-specific association.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The interacting SNP rs11072524, located in an intron of RYR3, was also assessed in the context of its interaction with rs2025994, indicating its relevance in understanding the genetic risk factors associated with severe long COVID.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for Severe and Fatigue Dominant Long COVID and Commonalities with ME/CFS Identified by Combinatorial Analysis

finding: The rs4702 variant associated with increased FURIN expression showed a low frequency in the Indian population, indicating a potentially reduced susceptibility to COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: Frequency differences of rs4932178 polymorphism in the Indian population were noted, indicating moderate susceptibility concerning FURIN expression.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The allele frequency of rs17514846 was significantly higher in Indians compared to EAS and AMR, linked to increased FURIN expression and potential COVID-19 effects.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The allele frequency of rs2120019 was reported as the highest in the Indian population, which could be associated with increased susceptibility to COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The allele frequency of rs2229117 showed association with increased COVID-19 severity, with the G allele observed to affect calcium levels.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: This SNP, part of the lung cancer susceptibility loci at 15q25.1, was examined alongside other variants (like rs8192479 and rs151118057) aiding the understanding of genetic predisposition to lung cancer.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: As with rs2229961, this SNP contributed to the 15q25.1 locus related to lung cancer susceptibility, thereby reinforcing the genetic links to lung cancer.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: This SNP was identified in association with lung cancer at the 15q25.1 locus alongside other related variants, further establishing insights into the genetic basis of lung cancer risk.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: This variant near the <italic>CYP1A1</italic> gene at 15q24 was shown to be statistically independent of smoking traits, linking it to lung cancer susceptibility without smoking confounding.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: As a sentinel variant for lung cancer at 15q25, it was prominently highlighted for its association with tobacco-related somatic mutation burdens, reinforcing smoking's role in lung cancer.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The rs953733 variant in DUOX2 was positively associated with iron deficiency anemias, indicating its importance in cadmium and iron status.
title: New insights into the genetic etiology of 57 essential and non-essential trace elements in humans

finding: The SNP rs12911841 located in an intron of MORF4L1 showed significant association with pSSNS (p = 3.88 × 10^-8), contributing to the pool of novel findings within the research.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2521501 showed robust evidence of association with hypertension risk through its proximity to the FES gene, which is involved in various signaling pathways affecting related biological processes.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects implicates genes involved in increased and decreased risk of hypertension

finding: The SNP rs140496989 at the TICRR locus demonstrated an effect size of -0.43 (P = 3.34 x 10^-8), marking it as a novel association linked to HbF levels, relevant to the analysis of the Nigerian patient population.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: The study identified rs201563586 as a highly Finnish-enriched missense variant within the LIPC region, which showed a high causal probability in fine-mapping analysis.
This SNP was included in the significant findings for HEXA, causing an amino acid substitution that linked to reduced Hex A activity, although its impact on protein function was uncertain.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Identified as significant in HEXA, this variant caused a tryptophan to arginine substitution. Its association did not indicate a clear impact on protein function.
title: Rare Variant Aggregation in 148,508 Exomes Identifies Genes Associated with Proxy Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The locus rs147301839, near GCOM1, was also listed as an important finding in previous GWAS, indicating its role in various cardiovascular conditions, including its association with AF.
title: Deciphering the genetic architecture of atrial fibrillation offers insights into disease prediction, pathophysiology and downstream sequelae

finding: The SNP rs12438724 was associated with fibrotic idiopathic interstitial pneumonias, showing a significant p-value of 4.10 x 10^-8. This SNP has been connected to cholesterol levels in the bloodstream.
title: Enhancing genotype-phenotype association with optimized machine learning and biological enrichment methods

finding: This SNP was identified in a meta-analysis between two cohorts correlating with neurodevelopmental conditions. It was significant with a p-value of 4.0x10^-8 and was associated with cognitive traits at its specific locus.
title: Dissecting the contribution of common variants to risk of rare neurodevelopmental conditions

finding: The variant rs528002287, located at locus 15q26.3 and associated with the gene PCSK6, was identified as unique to South Asia. It was linked to cardioembolic stroke and small vessel stroke within South Asians. This association was meaningful given that PCSK6 plays a critical role in regulating sodium homeostasis and diastolic blood pressure, reflecting population-specific risk drivers associated with stroke.
title: Ethnic and region-specific genetic risk variants of stroke and its comorbid conditions can define the variations in the burden of stroke and its phenotypic traits

finding: The SNP rs281287 was part of the 42 identified SNPs associated with the common liability to addiction, contributing to the genetic understanding of this shared risk.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: SNP rs76474922 was associated with cigarette use and mapped onto the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor genes, indicating its involvement in nicotine addiction.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: SNP rs8034191 acted as a cis-eQTL affecting gene expression related to nicotine receptors, further emphasizing its role in cigarette use.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs7174367 was identified as a cis-eQTL related to the expression of nicotinic acetylcholine receptor genes, suggesting its importance in addiction pathways.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: SNP rs12595350 was involved in nicotine modulation through the nicotinic receptors as a cis-eQTL, indicating its effect on cigarette use.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: SNP rs1052035 was linked to nicotinic pathways and showed relevance in nicotine dependency as a cis-eQTL.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: SNP rs72740960 acted as a cis-eQTL affecting nicotinic receptor genes, supporting its role in nicotine addiction.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs2197053, tagging TICRR/KIF7, was found to be significantly associated with low T1D PRS, suggesting a novel genetic risk factor for type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The research found that rs281238 exhibited a significant interaction with parental education (PE) on character recognition in children. Specifically, children with the 'T' genotype showed improved reading ability in high PE environments but performed poorly in low PE environments. In contrast, children with the 'CC' genotype did not show variability in reading ability based on their PE. This finding was consistent with the differential-susceptibility model.
title: Interaction between risk SNPs of Developmental Dyslexia and Parental Education on Reading Ability: Evidence for Differential-Susceptibility Theory

finding: The SNP rs4702 was identified in association with the FURIN gene in neurons by both the BIP GWAS and IBSEP methods. It was highlighted as one of the most significant SNPs related to multiple psychiatric disorders, establishing its importance in neuronal function and potential involvement in the mechanisms of mood regulation.
title: A unified framework for cell-type-specific eQTLs prioritization by integrating bulk and scRNA-seq data

finding: The SNP rs8042149 showed a genome-wide significant association with PTSD and was located in the RORA gene, highlighting its relevance in PTSD pathways.

finding: The SNP rs570487962 was associated with significantly higher expression of IG1FR in AD cases in African Americans, with a p-value of 0.0013 after correction for multiple testing.

finding: The SNP rs11071366, located within the gene ALDH1A2, was identified as having a posterior probability of 99% for a shared causal variant with colocalization effects on methylation and hand OA risk. The effect allele A correlated with decreased DNA methylation at two mQTLs (cg12031962 and cg12382153), consistent with previous findings of decreased expression in osteochondral tissue associated with OA.
title: Epigenetic mechanisms of osteoarthritis risk in human skeletal development

finding: The SNP rs12440045 was included in the analysis of six notable SNPs affecting transcription factor binding, supporting its potential role in mediating genetic influences on blood cell traits and cardiovascular disease.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: This SNP was identified as the most likely causal variant in the HCN4 locus with a reduced activation for its alternative alleles in cardiac cells. The enhancer containing this SNP interacted with the promoter of HCN4, which is important for cardiac rhythm control.
title: Single-cell genomics improves the discovery of risk variants and genes of Atrial Fibrillation

finding: The SNP rs2414098, located intronically within the CYP19A1 gene, was associated with an increased risk of both overall breast cancer (BC) and estrogen receptor positive (ER+) BC, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.03 (95% CI: 1.01-1.06) for overall BC and an OR of 1.06 (95% CI: 1.03-1.09) for ER+ BC. This SNP's involvement underlined its biological role in hormone levels, suggesting it may enhance the conversion of testosterone to estradiol, thus impacting BC risk. Notably, it had no significant effect on the risk of ER- BC.
title: Sex steroid hormones and risk of breast cancer incidence and survival: A two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs4702 was identified as a noncoding transcript variant located in the gene FURIN. It showed a previous association with opioid use disorders (OUD), emphasizing its relevance in genetic investigations of substance use disorders (SUDs) and externalizing behavior.
title: Advancing Gene Discovery for Substance Use Disorders Using Additional Traits Related to Behavioral Disinhibition

finding: The SNP rs528002287, located at locus 15q26.3 in the gene PCSK6, was identified as a low frequency variant unique to the South Asian population. It was associated with increased risk for cardioembolic stroke and small vessel stroke in South Asians. The variant was tagged to nearby variants in different frequencies across ethnicities, reflecting unique patterns of linkage disequilibrium (LD) that distinguished ethnogeographic differences in phenotype variation.
title: Ethnic and region-specific genetic risk variants of stroke and its comorbid conditions can define the variations in the burden of stroke and its phenotypic traits

finding: This novel variant was specifically significant in African ancestry and located in the intron of BLM, a gene involved in resolving G-quadruplex structures during telomere replication.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: The splice acceptor variant rs201988637 in the MFGE8 gene also exhibited a protective association against coronary atherosclerosis, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.72 (p = 7.94×10^-6). This variant was independent of rs534125149 and similarly showed no significant risk-increasing associations.
title: Loss-of-function of MFGE8 and protection against coronary atherosclerosis

finding: The SNP rs62023078 was located at the 15q22.31 locus, associated with febrile seizures (P = 4.97 × 10^-10, OR = 1.17). It resided in HERC1 and was involved in genomic regulation affecting E3 ubiquitin ligase activity following seizure episodes.
title: Genome-wide association study of febrile seizures identifies seven new loci implicating fever response and neuronal excitability genes

finding: Yang et al. used the rs16969968 variant in CHRNA5 to explore maternal effects on offspring phenotypes. Their study validated a known effect of maternal smoking heaviness on offspring birthweight and applied a gene-by-environment (G×E) MR approach to explore the transgenerational effects of maternal smoking on the health of offspring.
title: A systematic literature review of methodological approaches, challenges, and opportunities in the application of Mendelian randomisation to lifecourse epidemiology

finding: This SNP was associated with cortical thickness in the postcentral gyrus with a p-value of 2.7×10−15. It had also been linked with similar findings in three previous GWAS studies.

finding: Associated with cortical thickness in the postcentral gyrus with a p-value of 5.6×10−15, this SNP was highlighted in two recent GWAS where it related to cortical area in the precentral gyrus.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: The intronic SNP rs17601876 was associated with higher heel bone density and increased risk of endometrial cancer, reflecting its antagonistic role in bone health and reproductive cancer risk.

finding: This SNP was identified as having some previously studied GWAS association.

finding: This SNP was identified as having some previously studied GWAS association.

finding: The SNP rs35483472 was significantly associated with educational attainment (p=3 × 10^-12), suggesting educational factors may correlate with both anxiety and COVID-19 outcomes.

finding: The SNP rs117799466 was associated with alcohol consumption (p=3 × 10^-9), indicating that drinking behaviors could connect anxiety disorders to increased COVID-19 severity.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs8039126 had associations with mean platelet volume (p=2 × 10^-11), hinting at potential mechanisms linking platelet function alterations to anxiety and COVID-19 phenotypes.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs78319531 showed a significant association with hepatic protein levels (p=3 × 10^-8), suggesting a relationship between liver function and the anxiety-COVID-19 spectrum.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: SNP rs1129038 emerged from the replication studies reinforcing its role in age-related ocular disorders.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: Located on the RHPN2P1 gene, rs6599892 was hypothesized to have a role in AD due to its expression in the hippocampus and involvement in neuron and glial cell signaling.
title: New genetic loci discovery for Alzheimer’s disease using explainable deep neural networks

finding: Rs145197571 was part of an aggregation unit on chromosome 15, contributing significantly to T2D risk with its involvement in transcriptional regulation in islet tissues.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: Rs79569357 contributed nearly equally to test statistics in aggregation units linked to T2D, suggesting its relevance in disease mechanisms.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: Like the other two variants at this locus, rs28427880 was also implicated in T2D through its contribution to gene regulation in pancreatic islets.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: It was found that the obesity-related PLIN1 gene polymorphism rs1052700 influenced the interaction between meal timing and weight loss: AA carriers who consumed lunch late lost less weight compared to those who ate early, while TT carriers did not experience an effect based on lunch timing. This indicated a genetic influence on meal timing and weight management.

finding: The analysis showed that heterozygosity for the <italic>OCA2</italic>:c.1327G>A (p.Val443Ile) [rs74653330] variant, when present alongside <italic>TYR</italic>:c.1205G>A, significantly contributed to the diagnosis of albinism, demonstrating an odds ratio of 14.0 and enhancing the effects on visual acuity and central retinal thickness.

finding: The PCSK6 locus (rs1531817) showed a nominal genome-wide significant signal between PAD and LDL (bivariate P=3.2×10^-10). finding: The SNP rs12913832, mapping to the HERC2-OCA2 gene, was associated with eye colour and exhibited a significant connection to the risk of hemoglobinopathies, with a beta value of -0.35 and a p-value of <10^-762. finding: The genetic variant rs16969968 located at the CHRNA5 locus was used as an instrumental variable for smoking intensity in evaluating its effects on weight change. finding: Demonstrated opposing effects on injury/inflammation component across sexes, showcasing significant negative effects in males, while eliciting positive effects in females.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The rs4702 SNP was identified within the gene body of FURIN, classified as a strong candidate effector gene for schizophrenia (SCZ). Its exact functional implication in SCZ was not detailed but it resided near SCZ risk loci.

finding: It was identified as a cis-pQTL for LTK with an effect size of 0.69 (p=7.75x10^-13) and shown to causally affect type-2 diabetes risk, having a MR effect size of 0.054 and a high posterior probability of colocalisation (0.95).

finding: This SNP was part of the novel findings linking genetic risk factors between BMI and MS.

finding: In the linear model, rs10519203 emerged as the variant most associated with classifying pneumonia. finding: In stage 2, the SNP rs117618017 in the APH1B gene showed a p-value of 2.10×10^-13, indicating a significant association with Alzheimer’s disease.

SNP rs3131610 near USP50 showed a notable association with a p-value of 1.35×10^-8 in stage 3, linking it to Alzheimer’s disease.
The SPPL2A:rs59685680-G variant was identified as protective, playing a role in diminishing AD susceptibility.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The SNP rs12911841, located in an intron of MORF4L1, was identified as significantly associated with pSSNS with a p-value of 3.88 × 10−8, further expanding the loci implicated in this disease.

finding: The SNP rs936227 was associated with the protein ULK3, further emphasizing the link between dietary habits and BMI. This variant also explained more than 60% of the posterior probability of colocalization with the associated protein levels.

finding: Identified as a significant locus in association with ocular diseases through the GWAS datasets from the FinnGen project.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The SNP rs1051730 was found to be associated with the number of cigarettes smoked per day among mothers, which in turn affected their offspring's birth weight. Specifically, it was determined that having one A allele decreased offspring birth weight by approximately 17 grams among smoking mothers, with statistical significance at the 10% level. This association supported the hypothesis that maternal smoking caused reductions in birth weight.
title: The Interplay between Maternal Smoking and Genes in Offspring Birth Weight

finding: The SNP rs17239735 exhibited a genome-wide significant interaction with APOE ε2, highlighting a connection to AD risk. It was found that the effect of this SNP on AD risk among ε2 carriers opposed that observed in individuals with ε3/ε3 or ε3/ε4 genotypes, suggesting a nuanced role in the context of APOE genetics.
title: Protein phosphatase 2A, complement component 4, and APOE genotype linked to Alzheimer’s disease using a systems biology approach

finding: Similar to rs345593439, rs7173743 positioned within the MORF4L1 locus, indicated nominal significance in local genetic correlation with T1D and CAD, suggesting it may play a role in the genetic understanding of these conditions.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs72743461, mapped to the SMAD3 locus, was reported to show local genetic correlation between CAD and eosinophil count, suggesting it may have implications for understanding the risks associated with these health issues.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: Located in the SMAD3 locus alongside rs72743461, this SNP also presented local genetic correlations with CAD and eosinophil count, reinforcing the potential connectivity between these genetic factors.
title: Genetic relations between leukocyte counts, type 1 diabetes, and coronary artery disease

finding: This SNP at the 15q36.3 locus approached genome-wide significance with p=7.44×10^-8 and OR=4.15 in the replication GWAS and was proximal to embryonic heart enhancers.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: The SNP rs11635505 showed colocalization with regional myocardial-wall thickness at end-diastole and schizophrenia, indicating a significant genetic overlap in the 15q25.2 region.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs12902973 was linked to schizophrenia and demonstrated a high posterior probability (PPH4) of colocalization with the regional myocardial-wall thickness in the same region as rs11635505.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs1678983 showed association with functional connectivity between default mode and orbito-affective networks, indicating a link to brain function related to cardiovascular traits.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs17514846, associated with the gene FURIN, was found to share the same causal variant with PTSD in relation to global myocardial-wall thickness at end-diastole, with a colocalization probability of 92.5%.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The study identified the variant c.5125A>G (p.T1709A) as a likely pathogenic SNV in the <italic>STRC</italic> gene. This variant was noted to be the only divergent nucleotide between <italic>STRC</italic> and its pseudogene <italic>STRCP1</italic>, with the alternate nucleotide in <italic>STRC</italic> being represented as the reference nucleotide in the pseudogene. The pathogenicity of this variant was supported by predictive scores and assertions in ClinVar.
title: Comprehensive genetic analysis of STRC variants in hereditary hearing impairment using long-read sequencing

finding: Found as an intronic variant associated with HDL cholesterol and affecting expression of LIPC.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs572198006 revealed a significant difference in HRG frequencies, with females younger than 45 years having a higher frequency (11%) compared to older females (4%) and males (6%). This suggested a potential interaction between age of onset, sex, and genetic risk.
title: Role of common and rare genetic variants in the aetiology of trigeminal neuralgia

finding: This SNP associated with the FAH gene was found in individuals of African ancestries and replicated across independent samples, corroborating its relevance to suicide attempts.
title: Clinical, genomic, and neurophysiological correlates of lifetime suicide attempts among individuals with alcohol dependence

finding: The SNP rs2472297 was confirmed to be a known regulator of CYP1A2 activity, which was significantly linked to increased ANC. Increased CYP1A2 function indicated by this SNP was associated with higher neutrophil counts, and this relationship was maintained even after accounting for CYP1A2 pharmacogenomic activity scores.
title: Mediation and Longitudinal Analysis to interpret the association between clozapine pharmacokinetics, pharmacogenomics, and absolute neutrophil count

finding: It overlapped the APH1B promoter in oligodendrocytes, presenting a potential regulatory mechanism in Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Cell-type specific cis-eQTLs in eight brain cell-types identifies novel risk genes for human brain disorders

finding: The SNP (rs2521501) located near <italic>FES</italic> showed robust evidence for an association with hypertension, bolstering the confidence in its significance, though the exact mechanisms remain unclear.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects implicates genes involved in increased and decreased risk of hypertension

finding: Associated with FRMD5, it was linked to tumor progression through modulation of cancer cell mobility.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: This Finnish-enriched non-synonymous variant in LRRK1 exhibited a significant association with DD, indicating a role in the condition with an odds ratio of 3.18.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: This SNP provided a significant association with DD in a meta-analysis, supporting the connection at the LRRK1 locus.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: This lead SNP in the NEDD4 gene locus was significantly associated with DD and strongly correlated with another intronic variant, indicating a connection to fibrotic diseases.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: Part of the confirmed lead SNPs related to DD risk, replicating previous findings in the condition.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies in 614,243 individuals identifies 59 novel susceptibility loci underlying Dupuytren’s contracture

finding: The SNP rs1051730 was identified as significantly associated with maternal smoking behavior, particularly its role in quitting smoking during pregnancy. The study found that each additional copy of the risk allele was linked to higher odds of continuing to smoke during pregnancy as well as an increase in the number of cigarettes smoked per day. This SNP is located in the CHRNA5-CHRNA3-CHRNB4 gene cluster on chromosome 15 and does not associate with smoking initiation.
title: Smoking during pregnancy and its effect on placental weight: A Mendelian randomization study

finding: For SNP rs1129038, it was noted to interact with the genomic region near the HERC2 gene's promoter. HERC2 was significantly associated with cataract via meta-analysis, highlighting its potential relevance in eye disorders alongside GABRA5 and GABRB3.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The rs2290572 variant was identified as a lead sQTL for ULK3, associated with various CAD-relevant traits, reinforcing its pathogenic role through splicing mechanisms.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: The lead eQTL variant rs12898397 for ULK3 demonstrated substantial association in gene expression in arterial tissues, suggesting it plays a critical role in the genetic regulation of CAD.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs3825991 was associated with RLBP1, which is involved in the retinoid cycle and linked to retinal dystrophies, showing a significant relationship with PRC layer thickness.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The SNP rs16969968 was associated with brain reactivity to smoking images in nicotine dependent women, indicating its relevance to cue reactivity in substance use disorders (SUDs). This finding suggested that genetic variation at this locus could influence the neurocognitive mechanisms underlying responses to drug-related cues.
title: A Methodological Checklist for fMRI Drug Cue Reactivity Studies: Development and Expert Consensus

finding: The rs11556089 variant of the SMAD3 gene was weakly associated with PD, showing an odds ratio of 0.49 (95% CI 0.26–0.93, p = 0.0375), although it did not reach significance in every analysis phase.
title: TGFB1 rs8179181 polymorphism is reproducibly associated with Parkinson’s disease in a Spanish population

finding: The SNP rs2472297, located in the CYP1A1/1A2 region, was confirmed as a significant variant affecting both clozapine and norclozapine plasma concentrations. This SNP was identified as the only causal signal for clozapine and norclozapine metabolism, with a perfect posterior probability index (PPI=1), reinforcing its role in the pharmacokinetics of clozapine.
title: Pharmacokinetics and pharmacogenomics of clozapine in an ancestrally diverse sample: A longitudinal analysis and GWAS using clinical monitoring data from the UK

finding: The SNP rs35175834 was also highlighted among the significant markers in the Neurodevelopmental GenomicSEM GWAS, near the gene SEMA6D. This gene has prior associations with neuronal functions and neurodevelopmental conditions.
title: Enhancing the Discriminatory Power of ADHD and Autism Spectrum Disorder Polygenic Scores in Clinical and Non-Clinical Samples

finding: The rs11853426 variant in the ANXA2 gene was found to be significantly associated with stroke risk among SCD patients, with a P-value of 0.003434 and an odds ratio of 1.97 (95% CI 1.25-3.11), implicating this variant as a genetic risk factor for stroke.
title: Genetic variants associated with the risk of stroke in sickle cell disease: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: This SNP exhibited opposite influences on the inflammation component (PC3), displaying a negative effect in males (-0.50SD, SE=0.12, p=1.6*10^-5) and a positive effect in females (+0.41SD, SE=0.12, p=5.3*10^-4).
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The rs2251086 variant at the VPS13C locus was identified among the highest PAR estimates for all populations in the context of Parkinson's disease.
title: Multi-ancestry population attributable risk assessment of common genetic variation in Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s diseases

finding: The heterozygosity for <italic>OCA2</italic>:c.1327G>A (p.Val443Ile) was shown to interact synergistically with <italic>TYR</italic>:c.1205G>A, significantly raising the likelihood of receiving a diagnosis of albinism. The analysis yielded an odds ratio of 7.9.
title: The co-occurrence of genetic variants in the TYR and OCA2 genes confers susceptibility to albinism

finding: The variant rs176647 at locus 15q26.1 was associated with insomnia and exhibited shared genetic influences with DTI parameters.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: The rs6598541-A SNP was identified as a fasting glucose-associated variant, reported to be associated with increased glucose levels by 0.0114 mmol/L (95% CI: [0.0097-0.0131]) with a significance of p=4×10^-12. This finding highlighted its role in glucose metabolism, linking it to the risk of Type 2 diabetes.
title: Damaging missense variants in IGF1R implicate a role for IGF-1 resistance in the aetiology of type 2 diabetes

finding: The rs59646751-T SNP was reported to increase the risk of Type 2 diabetes with an odds ratio of 1.024 (95% CI: [1.020-1.028]) and was significant at p=4×10^-9. This SNP is intronic within the IGF1R gene and contributes to T2D susceptibility.
title: Damaging missense variants in IGF1R implicate a role for IGF-1 resistance in the aetiology of type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs12916839 exhibited significant association with the gene FGF7, with a P-value of 6.28×10^-7. It showed down-regulated effects on FGF7 expression in OCC patients and was noted as a splicing quantitative trait locus (sQTL) across multiple tissues.
title: Integrated multi-omics data analysis identifies a novel genetics-risk gene of IRF4 associated with prognosis of oral cavity cancer

finding: The SNP rs117878928 at the 15q25.1 locus exhibited a significant interaction with the DASH diet score in relation to systolic blood pressure (SBP), with a P value for interaction of 4e-8. In the European population, the interaction effect size was measured at 0.42±0.09 mm Hg in the CHARGE cohorts and 0.20±0.06 mm Hg in the UK Biobank (P for interaction=9.4e-7 and 0.001, respectively). This SNP was identified as potentially causal independent of other GWAS SNPs, having a posterior probability of H3=0.97.
title: Genome-Wide Interaction Analysis with DASH Diet Score Identified Novel Loci for Systolic Blood Pressure

finding: The missense variant rs75638145-A in TRPM1 was significantly associated with thinning of the inner nuclear layer (INL), inner plexiform layer (IPL), and ganglion cell layer (GCL), indicating its potential role in retinal layer morphology.
title: Insights into human health from phenome- and genome-wide analyses of UK Biobank retinal optical coherence tomography phenotypes

finding: The lead variant rs6598541 was queried for its associations with gout and other traits, showing strong linkage and positive colocalization in cardiovascular studies.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: The SNP rs1195500, located in the gene FAM189A1, was successfully replicated in the Israeli population after Bonferroni correction, demonstrating a significant association with AMD with a p-value of less than 0.0001.
title: Genome-wide association study and genomic risk prediction of age-related macular degeneration in Israel

finding: The rs16969968 SNP located in the CHRNA5–A3–B4 genomic locus was associated with smoking behavior. It was found that individuals with the 'AA' genotype, which represents the less common allele, tended to inhale more smoke when the nicotine content in cigarettes was increased. Specifically, each additional copy of this allele was estimated to correlate with approximately one additional cigarette smoked per day. Furthermore, this SNP was consistently identified in genome-wide association studies (GWAS) related to smoking and was linked to an earlier diagnosis of smoking-related diseases such as chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and lung cancer, establishing smoking as a critical factor in the health implications of this locus.
title: The causal effect of cigarette smoking on healthcare costs

finding: Identified as a lead variant specifically associated with exudative forms of glaucoma (XFS).
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The SNP rs10902588 was associated with anti-NMDAR encephalitis, located in the LRRK1 gene. The odds ratio was 2.24, indicating a significant increase in risk for the disease (P = 1.78 × 10^-8). This finding highlighted the potential role of the LRRK1 gene in the pathogenesis of this autoimmune condition.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies two new loci associated with anti-NMDAR encephalitis
