This finding highlighted that while the variant was nearly fixed in single ancestry groups due to strong directional selection, it became detectable in GWAS conducted in admixed populations, where allele frequencies were more intermediate due to the mixing of ancestries.
title: Admixed Populations Improve Power for Variant Discovery and Portability in Genome-wide Association Studies

finding: The SNP rs269868 was identified as being positively selected in the Andean populations, characterized by a significant increase in the C allele frequency from 0.01 in Amazon populations to 0.53 in Andean populations. This SNP, which results in a missense mutation (Ser1067Leu), is located in an A-loop region of the DUOX2 gene that interacts with its coactivator DUOXA2, potentially impacting the protein's stability and function related to thyroid hormone synthesis.
title: The genetic structure and adaptation of Andean highlanders and Amazonian dwellers is influenced by the interplay between geography and culture

finding: The SNP rs57659670 exhibited a similar pattern of positive selection, with the C allele frequency also increasing from 0.01 in Amazon populations to 0.53 in Andean populations. This SNP results in a missense mutation (His678Arg) in the DUOX2 gene and contributes to the genetic adaptation to the high-altitude Andean environment, although the exact implications for thyroid function versus innate immunity remain unclear.
title: The genetic structure and adaptation of Andean highlanders and Amazonian dwellers is influenced by the interplay between geography and culture

finding: The rs762551 SNP was found to be significantly associated with caffeine-induced hypertension in a study of the Pakistani population, evidenced by a p-value of 0.039. The research indicated that individuals with the C allele of this variant have decreased CYP1A2 activity, which increases their vulnerability to hypertension. This finding corroborated with previous studies that suggested a consistent association between the C allele and elevated blood pressure risk.
title: Genetic Association of CYP1A2 Gene Variant (rs762551) with Caffeine Induced-Hypertension Susceptibility and Cytochrome P450 1A2 Protein Analyses

finding: The A915V mutation linked to BLM was associated with Bloom syndrome and breast cancer.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: The rs578595 SNP lies within the WDR72 gene, associated with pathways influencing calcium-sensing reception; specific associations with nephrolithiasis were indicated but not detailed.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs1426654 in the SLC24A5 gene was linked to skin color variation. It was identified as evolving under local adaptive forces and ranked in the top 5% of the MU distribution.
title: Network-based analysis of allele frequency distribution among multiple populations identifies adaptive genomic structural variants

finding: The SNP rs12913832 in the OCA gene was previously reported to relate to pigmentation traits and was found in the top 5% of the MU distribution, indicating strong evidence of adaptive evolution.
title: Network-based analysis of allele frequency distribution among multiple populations identifies adaptive genomic structural variants

finding: The variant rs290164 displayed a significant frequency difference between populations (ΔDAF = 28%), which explained approximately 76% of the differences in isomiR ratios for miR-146a-3p, highlighting its impact on miRNA expression differences between African and European ancestry individuals.
title: Population variation of miRNAs and isomiRs and their impact on human immunity to infection

finding: The SNP rs12914385 was identified to have a strong association with lung cancer in the GENEVA data, reflecting a p-value of 1.887 x 10^-15. Further analysis showed that this SNP also had a strong association with the dichotomized smoking pack-years (p=1.364×10^-6). The mediation analysis indicated that the effect of rs12914385 on lung cancer risk was predominantly a direct effect (OR_NDE=1.333) rather than an indirect effect through the smoking pack-years mediator (OR_NIE=1.019). The test of the indirect effect was statistically significant (p=0.0494), suggesting some influence of smoking pack-years on the association with lung cancer risk.
title: Efficient Estimation of Indirect Effects in Case-Control Studies Using a Unified Likelihood Framework

finding: Linked to SMAD3, this variant acted as a positive control in regulatory assays, reaffirming its association with gene expression changes in relation to CAD.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: The SNP rs11071720, located within the 3rd intron of the TPM1 gene, acted as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) linked with decreased TPM1 expression, higher platelet count, and lower MPV. The minor allele of this SNP disrupted a GATA binding site.
title: Tropomyosin 1 genetically constrains in vitro hematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs2073711 (A/G) resides in the CILP gene and was associated with cartilage scaffolding. Temporal variations indicated an increase in the frequency of this risk allele, which aligned with the dietary shifts linked to the transition to a sedentary lifestyle.
title: A genomic dating tool resolves the origins of ancient Eurasian genomes

finding: The rs7183877 (C/A), part of a haplotype associated with blue eyes, demonstrated significant temporal variations in allele frequency, suggesting its relevance as a marker for eye color traits among European populations.
title: A genomic dating tool resolves the origins of ancient Eurasian genomes

finding: Similar to rs7183877, rs8028689 (T/C) was identified within the haplotype spanning the HERC gene and showed significant variations that related to eye color traits, further substantiating its association.
title: A genomic dating tool resolves the origins of ancient Eurasian genomes

finding: This SNP, located in the CHRNA5 gene, has been established as a well-known functional missense variant associated with nicotine dependence, lending support to the genetic basis of smoking behavior.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: In the fetal cortex, rs35828350 was shown to upregulate NMB, a gene critical for physiological processes; whereas in adults, it downregulated WDR73, linked to microtubule dynamics.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: The SNP rs12913832 was identified as a significant modulator of human pigmentation. It was demonstrated that this SNP attenuated chromatin-loop formation between a long-range enhancer and the OCA2 promoter, indicating a regulatory mechanism affecting pigmentation traits.
title: BEHST: genomic set enrichment analysis enhanced through integration of chromatin long-range interactions

finding: The rs757148409 mutation in the OTUD7A gene resulted in a premature stop codon (p.Arg89Ter) and was identified in three schizophrenia (SZ) patients but not in controls, indicating a potential association with SZ. In functional assays, CRISPR/Cas9-engineered human induced pluripotent stem cell (hiPSC)-derived neurons carrying this mutation exhibited significantly reduced OTUD7A protein levels (~50% decrease), dendritic complexity, and synaptic protein density, suggesting that this LoF mutation may impair synapse development and neuronal function.
title: Loss-of-function of OTUD7A in the schizophrenia-associated 15q13.3 deletion impairs synapse development and function in human neurons

finding: The SNP rs2433603 in the GATM locus was associated with estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) with a p-value of 2.4×10^−9. This finding was considered novel and distinct from previously reported associations, marking it as an original finding for eGFR in the Ugandan population.
title: Discovery and fine-mapping of kidney function loci in first genome-wide association study in Africans

finding: SNP rs35346340 was identified as a potential causal variant at the FES/FURIN locus. This SNP disrupted the TCF21 binding motif, which led to a decrease in the binding of TCF21 to the FES promoter, resulting in decreased FES expression. Conversely, it increased the expression of the nearby lncRNA 43779.9, which in turn regulated FES expression negatively while increasing FURIN expression, thus highlighting the complex regulation of CAD risk.
title: LncRNA de novo discovery reveals noncoding RNAs as major molecular mechanism associating coronary artery disease GWAS variants with causal genes to confer disease risk

finding: SNP rs7183988 was identified as a TCF21 binding QTL within the TCF21 peak, contributing to regulatory mechanisms at the FES/FURIN locus, indicating a significant role in gene expression regulation related to CAD.
title: LncRNA de novo discovery reveals noncoding RNAs as major molecular mechanism associating coronary artery disease GWAS variants with causal genes to confer disease risk

finding: SNP rs4932373 was noted as an eQTL for FES and a lncRNA QTL for 43779.9, suggesting it plays a role in modulating gene expression relevant to CAD progression.
title: LncRNA de novo discovery reveals noncoding RNAs as major molecular mechanism associating coronary artery disease GWAS variants with causal genes to confer disease risk

finding: SNP rs7497304 was also reported as an eQTL for FES and a lncRNA QTL for 43779.9, reinforcing its involvement in expression modulation at the FES/FURIN locus indicative of CAD risk.
title: LncRNA de novo discovery reveals noncoding RNAs as major molecular mechanism associating coronary artery disease GWAS variants with causal genes to confer disease risk

finding: SNP rs2071382 was described as a CAD GWAS SNP leading to decreased FES expression, identifying it as a risk allele in CAD, thus linking it to the disease progression.
title: LncRNA de novo discovery reveals noncoding RNAs as major molecular mechanism associating coronary artery disease GWAS variants with causal genes to confer disease risk

finding: The rs8032315 SNP exhibited differential enhancer activity under stimulation and TTX conditions, affecting the eQTL regulation of the FURIN gene, showing higher activity for the T allele in TTX conditions.
title: Cell type and condition specific functional annotation of schizophrenia associated non-coding genetic variants

finding: The rs35346340 SNP displayed lower expression for the C allele under TTX treatment, correlated with the eQTL effects on the FES gene, while no difference was observed under stimulation conditions.
title: Cell type and condition specific functional annotation of schizophrenia associated non-coding genetic variants

finding: The rs4702 SNP showed highly allele-specific activity in induced neurons, classified as a non-enhancer emVar, it was located outside an open chromatin region.
title: Cell type and condition specific functional annotation of schizophrenia associated non-coding genetic variants

finding: The intron variant rs112917869 within the THSD4 gene was found to be associated with increased bitterness perception of sucralose, also reaching genome-wide significance with a p-value of 7.9e-11.
title: Worldwide study of the taste of bitter medicines and their modifiers

finding: The SNP rs1800414 was identified as related to light skin evolution in East Asians and has been reported multiple times in previous studies. This SNP was included in the context of understanding the genetic basis for the light skin phenotype in both East Asian and Native American populations.
title: Ancient DNA supports that the evolution of Skin Tone in East Asians intensified after their split with Native Americans

finding: The SNP rs74653330 was reported in a study focusing on light skin in East Asians. It was utilized to correct the beta value for rs1800414 in the analysis, highlighting its association with the light skin phenotype in these populations.
title: Ancient DNA supports that the evolution of Skin Tone in East Asians intensified after their split with Native Americans

finding: The rs10519203 variant was linked to the causal pathway involving pack-years of smoking affecting waist-hip ratio (WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub>), highlighting its role in understanding the obesity implications of long-term smoking.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The variant rs150353 was associated with the effects of pack-years of smoking on waist circumference (WC), further illustrating the genetic components influencing fat distribution linked to smoking.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The rs1317286 variant was found to exclusively drive the positive causal association between current cigarettes per day and waist-hip ratio (WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub>), marking its significance as a locus linked to smoking heaviness.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The rs12913832 SNP in the HERC2 gene represented a crucial point mutation (A to G) that was identified as the main determinant of blue eye color in European populations. The derived G allele associated with this SNP was shown to have undergone positive selection, indicating an adaptive advantage possibly linked to enhanced low-light visual acuity seen in blue-eyed individuals, as demonstrated in the study.
title: Effect of iris pigmentation of blue and brown eyed individuals with European ancestry on ability to see in low light conditions after a short-term dark adaption period

finding: The SNP rs146353869, located in the FAN1 gene, was identified as having a minor allele frequency of 2% and was associated with an average alteration in the age of onset (AOO) of Huntington disease (HD) by 6.1 years. This finding illustrated that, despite the rarity of this SNP, it had a significant impact on the AOO of HD, further emphasizing its relevance as a genetic modifier alongside the previously characterized LOI (loss of interruption) variant.
title: Length of uninterrupted CAG repeats, independent of polyglutamine size, results in increased somatic instability and hastened age of onset in Huntington disease

finding: For the rs12913832 SNP, only three individuals carried the G allele associated with blue eye color, while seven had the A allele associated with brown eye color. Eight individuals displayed both alleles.
title: Neolithic genomes reveal a distinct ancient HLA allele pool and population transformation in Europe

finding: This SNP, previously associated with schizophrenia, reinforced known genetic links to psychiatric conditions.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: This non-coding SNP was identified as a disease onset-delaying variant associated with increased FAN1 expression, which correlated with reduced somatic CAG expansions. Its effects potentially delayed the onset of Huntington's disease (HD) by influencing the dynamics of repeat expansions.
title: FAN1 nuclease processes and pauses on disease-associated slipped-DNA repeats: Mechanism against repeat expansions

finding: The coding variant p.R377W (rs151322829) was noted to act as an onset-hastening variant for HD. This variant was significant due to its previously reported association with various disorders, where it might have unknown effects on FAN1's functions.
title: FAN1 nuclease processes and pauses on disease-associated slipped-DNA repeats: Mechanism against repeat expansions

finding: The coding variant p.R507H (rs150393409) was also identified as hastening disease onset in Huntington’s disease. Similar to rs151322829, its role in FAN1 function remained unclear.
title: FAN1 nuclease processes and pauses on disease-associated slipped-DNA repeats: Mechanism against repeat expansions

finding: The p.P724L variant (rs761141548), found exclusively in individuals with expanded CGG repeats associated with autism spectrum disorder (ASD), was noted for its prevalence in this population, linking it to the broader spectrum of repeat expansion diseases.
title: FAN1 nuclease processes and pauses on disease-associated slipped-DNA repeats: Mechanism against repeat expansions

finding: Similar to rs35811129, this non-coding variant was associated with increased FAN1 expression, leading to delayed disease onset by reducing somatic CAG expansions in affected individuals.
title: FAN1 nuclease processes and pauses on disease-associated slipped-DNA repeats: Mechanism against repeat expansions

finding: This SNP was part of a systematic review and meta-analysis that identified its association with Alzheimer's disease risk among 11,051 subjects, indicating its relevance in genetic susceptibility to dementia.
title: Identification of Key Pathways and Genes in Dementia via Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: This SNP was also analyzed in the same systematic review, revealing its association with Alzheimer's disease risk, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in dementia.
title: Identification of Key Pathways and Genes in Dementia via Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: Included in the systematic review, this SNP was associated with Alzheimer's disease risk, reinforcing its significance in the genetic landscape of dementia.
title: Identification of Key Pathways and Genes in Dementia via Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: Identified in the systematic review as well, this SNP had an association with Alzheimer's disease risk, highlighting further genetic links to dementia.
title: Identification of Key Pathways and Genes in Dementia via Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: Part of the systematic review, this SNP showed an association with Alzheimer's disease risk, contributing to the overall understanding of genetic factors in dementia.
title: Identification of Key Pathways and Genes in Dementia via Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: This SNP was also mentioned in the systematic review, showing an association with Alzheimer's disease risk, indicating its potential role in susceptibility to dementia.
title: Identification of Key Pathways and Genes in Dementia via Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: Included in the systematic review, this SNP was associated with Alzheimer's disease risk, underscoring its importance in the genetics of dementia.
title: Identification of Key Pathways and Genes in Dementia via Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: This SNP was part of the systematic review's analysis, demonstrating its association with Alzheimer's disease risk, further elucidating genetic contributions to dementia.
title: Identification of Key Pathways and Genes in Dementia via Integrated Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs11070970 was significantly associated with altered expression levels of miR-221 and miR-222, which are known to act as oncogenes in various cancers. This association contributed to the identification of metabolic cancer subtypes and helped link these subtypes to survival probabilities, tumor grades, and other clinical phenotypes, providing insights into potential therapeutic strategies.
title: Cancer metabolic subtypes and their association with molecular and clinical features

finding: This SNP exhibited significant genetic interactions observed in multiple brain regions, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors involved in Alzheimer’s disease, together with other identified SNPs.
title: Functional biological paths altered in Alzheimer’s disease: from genes to bile acids

finding: The SNP rs1380986 located in chromosome 22 showed a connection to autism (AUT), with a MAF of 0.0006, an Info score of 0.498, and a p-value of 8.01 × 10⁻¹⁵, suggesting a noteworthy association.
title: Increasing the resolution and precision of psychiatric GWAS by re-imputing summary statistics using a large, diverse reference panel

finding: At the RASGRP1 locus, rs55728265 was prioritized as a significant variant in strong linkage disequilibrium with the lead variant, rs35134214. It was found to overlap the RASGRP1 promoter region, indicating its role in mediating T1D risk.
title: Single-cell gene expression and chromatin accessibility profiling of human pancreatic islets at basal and stimulatory conditions nominates mechanisms of type 1 diabetes genetic risk

finding: The study revealed that the SNP rs11070948 is associated with the fatty acid desaturase gene SCD1, which was found to be upregulated by Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) and is crucial for EBV-induced B cell proliferation. This link illustrates the potential impact of SCD1 on the metabolic pathways involved in the proliferation of EBV-transformed cells.
title: Fatty acid desaturases link cell metabolism pathways to promote proliferation of Epstein-Barr virus-infected B cells

finding: The rs2470152 polymorphism in CYP19A1 was found to increase susceptibility to depression.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs11070948 was identified in the context of Stearoyl-CoA desaturase 1 (SCD1), which was discussed as a therapeutic target in cancer treatment. Specifically, the finding related to the modulation of metabolic pathways from tumor metabolism influenced by SCD1, suggesting a pathophysiological link to chemoresistance in tumor cells.
title: Mitochondrial sites of contact with the nucleus aid in chemotherapy evasion of glioblastoma cells

finding: The SNP rs1899754 mapping to RP11-209K10.2 was linked with hsCRP levels in the study.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The novel SNP rs28608119, also in RP11-209K10.2, was identified with hsCRP levels.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The rs13180 SNP was identified as a protective factor, where individuals carrying more copies of the minor allele "T" had significantly higher mean values for both cigarettes per day (CPD) (p=8.77×10⁻⁵) and FA measures (p=5.99×10⁻⁵). This genetic variant was associated with inherently higher white matter integrity, despite being a risk allele for increased nicotine addiction. The study found that CPD acted as a competing mediator with an indirect effect (p=0.012) opposite to the direct effect of the SNP on FA, further implicating the complex relationship between this SNP and brain structural integrity related to neurodegeneration.
title: White matter integrity and nicotine dependence in smokers: evaluating vertical and horizontal pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs1801320, relevant for breast cancer susceptibility in BRCA1 and BRCA2 carriers, displayed significant differences in allele frequencies between Ukrainians and adjacent populations.
title: Genome Diversity in Ukraine

finding: The SNP rs2472299 was identified through ImageNet transferGWAS analysis, achieving strong significance (p = 3 x 10^-10). It was previously associated with blood pressure traits, linking it to systolic and diastolic blood pressure in a large sample size. However, in baseline GWAS, it only reached p-values of 7 x 10^-4 for these traits.
title: TransferGWAS: GWAS of images using deep transfer learning

finding: The SNP rs11071014 was associated with the therapeutic response to drug combinations, particularly with MDM2 inhibitors like siremadlin in enhancing p53 activity against wild-type p53 rhabdomyosarcoma (p53 WT RMS). The study indicated that this SNP may play a role in how effectively these drugs can synergistically work to inhibit tumor growth.
title: Combined inhibition of MDM2 and PARP lead to a synergistic anti-tumoral response in p53 wild-type rhabdomyosarcoma models

finding: The SNP rs12913832 in the gene HERC2 was found to interact with SLC45A2 to affect eye color in Europeans. Despite some discussion around its role as a tag for the OCA2 gene, this interaction exemplified how allele frequency differences among populations correlate with known two-locus interactions.
title: Detection of complex genetic architecture using two-locus population differentiation: modeling epistasis

finding: At the RASGRP1 locus, rs55728265 was prioritized and found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs35134214, the lead variant. This SNP overlapped the RASGRP1 promoter region but did not co-access with other promoters, supporting its candidacy in T1D risk.
title: Single-cell gene expression and chromatin accessibility profiling of human pancreatic islets at basal and stimulatory conditions nominates mechanisms of type 1 diabetes genetic risk

finding: Found in connection with schizophrenia, this SNP adds to the genetic understanding of serious mental illnesses.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: A significant association was identified between SNP rs372754794 and variation in L cone ratios, with a p-value of 1.67 × 10^-5. The minor (G) allele was linked to reduced L cone ratios and was prevalent primarily among African American and African populations. This SNP resided in the intron of a non-coding RNA (NR2F2-AS1) and was found upstream of the NR2F2 gene, which is involved in retinoic acid signaling during early retinal development.
title: Spatiotemporal specification of human green and red cones

finding: At the OCA2 locus, rs12913832 was identified as a common causal variant for eQTL, meQTL, and melanoma risk, showcasing its role in regulating OCA2 expression through a long-range enhancer.
title: Cell-type-specific meQTL extends melanoma GWAS annotation beyond eQTL and informs melanocyte gene regulatory mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs17293632 was identified as an important modifier of myocardial infarction risk through its regulatory effect on SMAD3 expression within a functional smooth muscle enhancer. This finding was significant as it linked the TGFβ signaling pathway and smooth muscle biology directly to the risk of coronary artery disease (CAD). In vitro evidence suggested that SMAD3 influenced smooth muscle cell (SMC) differentiation and proliferation, although the exact mechanisms by which SMAD3 expression affected SMC plaque biology remained poorly understood.
title: Smad3 Regulates Smooth Muscle Cell Fate and Governs Adverse Remodeling and Calcification of Atherosclerotic Plaque

finding: The SNP rs10519203 was found to be highly correlated with rs8042849 and rs72743158, supporting its association with COPD traits. Despite its physical distance from these other SNPs, it remained in the same dense linkage disequilibrium (LD) block as per the novel <italic>ℓ</italic><sub>0</sub> graph norm shrinkage algorithm.
title: Genetic Fine-mapping with Dense Linkage Disequilibrium Blocks: genetics of nicotine dependence

finding: The SNP rs8042849 showed strong correlations with rs10519203 and rs72743158. This finding was pivotal as it was part of the same dense LD block, highlighting its role in traits associated with COPD despite the large physical distance from other correlated SNPs.
title: Genetic Fine-mapping with Dense Linkage Disequilibrium Blocks: genetics of nicotine dependence

finding: The SNP rs72743158, correlated with rs10519203 and rs8042849, was identified as a significant variant in the context of nicotine addiction and its potential association with COPD. Its inclusion in the same LD block despite a substantial physical distance indicated shared genetic influences on traits related to smoking severity.
title: Genetic Fine-mapping with Dense Linkage Disequilibrium Blocks: genetics of nicotine dependence

finding: The top lead variant rs16968876 was identified as associated with cortical surface area, contributing to an understanding of brain morphology heritability.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association study identifies 1735 unique genetic loci associated with cortical morphology

finding: The top lead variant rs8032326 was associated with cortical thickness, highlighting its relevance in the study of structural brain anatomy.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association study identifies 1735 unique genetic loci associated with cortical morphology

finding: The SNP rs12913832 (OCA2/HERC2) demonstrated moderate evidence for selection (s ~ 0.002). This SNP is critical for blue-brown eye color, showing that selection may have begun around 50,000 years ago, earlier than previously suggested.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The SNP rs4702, located in the 3' region of the gene FURIN, was effectively edited using a CRISPR/Cas9 system. Bulk analysis demonstrated editing efficiencies ranging from 21.7% to 52.2% across five tested human induced pluripotent stem cell lines. This finding was significant as it provided evidence of the potential for gene editing in high and low schizophrenia polygenic risk score (PRS) contexts.
title: Publicly available hiPSC lines with extreme polygenic risk scores for modeling schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs16968876 was identified as a significant association with sulcal depth through a genome-wide association study involving 33,748 participants. This finding related to the genetic regulation of brain morphology, particularly in sulcal depth, which had been linked to various neurodevelopmental disorders. This discovery underscored the potential of using sulcal depth as a meaningful MRI phenotype in understanding human cortical morphology.
title: The genetic architecture of human cortical folding

finding: The SNP rs8040868 in CHRNA3 was significantly associated with a higher number of cigarettes per day (CPD), with β = 0.34 (SD = 0.13, p = 0.009), indicating it may enhance smoking behavior.
title: Gene-Gene interactions and pleiotropy in the brain nicotinic pathway associated with the heaviness and precocity of tobacco smoking among outpatients with multiple substance use disorders

finding: The rs12913832 SNP, an intronic variant of the HERC2 gene, was associated with both blonde hair and skin color, achieving P-values of 2.87 × 10⁻⁵⁶ for blonde hair and 5.33 × 10⁻¹⁹¹ for skin color.
title: Analysis of genetic dominance in the UK Biobank

finding: The study identified rs16968876 located on chromosome 15 as a significant genetic locus associated with sulcal depth, demonstrating a notable link to neurodevelopmental processes. This discovery was part of a larger genome-wide association study involving 33,748 participants, and highlighted the potential of sulcal depth as a promising MRI phenotype for understanding human cortical morphology.
title: The genetic architecture of human cortical folding

finding: It was validated that rs2033937 was associated with chromosomal contacts with the THBS1 gene, indicating a significant role in enhancer-promoter connectivity.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: It was found that rs12438271 overlapped with GWAS signals for mean platelet volume and indicated a strong mediation effect for chromatin accessibility influencing gene expression outcomes.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The genetic variant rs17514846 was identified as a lead single nucleotide polymorphism associated with increased coronary artery disease (CAD) risk. The A allele of rs17514846 was shown to enhance the expression of the FURIN gene in monocytes, while the C allele resulted in methylation at a CpG site that inhibited expression. Specific experimental approaches, including gene editing and DNA methylation inhibitors, confirmed that the C allele's methylation prevented the binding of the transcription factor MeCP2, a known repressor, leading to diminished FURIN expression. This position was also associated with greater monocyte migration and proliferation when MeCP2 was knocked down.
title: Allele-specific epigenetic regulation of FURIN expression at a coronary artery disease susceptibility locus

finding: SNP rs4932198 was part of a cluster of 25 genome-wide significant SNPs located near the ACAN gene, implicated in short stature and skeletal dysplasia. These 25 SNPs accounted for more than 40% of the variation in VNTR length across multiple ancestries and provided an additional ∼0.24% contribution to phenotypic variance in height in Europeans beyond that explained by the VNTR alone. This highlights the complex interactions of different genetic variations influencing height.
title: A Saturated Map of Common Genetic Variants Associated with Human Height from 5.4 Million Individuals of Diverse Ancestries

finding: The SNP rs12915901 was identified as a key target variant in the context of osteoarthritis, particularly due to its functional characterization within the gene ALDH1A2. This finding highlighted the gene's relevance in osteoarthritis-related genetic risk.
title: Decoding the genomic basis of osteoarthritis

finding: Similar to rs10502437, the SNP rs12901372 also displayed colocalisation with eQTLs in both low-grade and high-grade cartilage, underscoring its importance in the genetic interaction involved in osteoarthritis.
title: Decoding the genomic basis of osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs11071010 was identified in relation to the early stages of tumorigenesis affecting lung function, particularly in the context of alveolar and capillary functions. This finding was described in a study related to lung-seeking metastases and suggested that variations at this locus could influence the progression of tumors and how effective treatments might be.
title: Crystal ribcage: a platform for probing real-time lung function at cellular resolution in health and disease

finding: This SNP was linked to SLC12A6, which shows increased binding affinities for several repressive transcription factors, including SP1, ZN281, and MAZ. These factors are involved in neuronal differentiation and have been shown to have increased expression levels in SCZ. The findings suggested enhanced repression of SLC12A6 due to this SNP, implicating a mechanism for potassium uptake impairments in SCZ.
title: Unveiling causal regulatory mechanisms through cell-state parallax

finding: This SNP located in the CILP gene was shown to be a TIM with increasing frequency over time. The trends in allele frequency indicated a possible linkage to changes in lifestyle and diet, particularly due to the transition towards a sedentary lifestyle.
title: A genomic dating tool resolves the origins of ancient Eurasian genomes

finding: As part of a haplotype associated with blue eye color, this TIM showed significant temporal variation. The SNP was found predominantly in Caucasians, suggesting strong selective pressures over time favoring certain pigmentation traits.
title: A genomic dating tool resolves the origins of ancient Eurasian genomes

finding: This SNP, also part of the haplotype associated with eye color, showed fluctuations in allele frequency over time, alongside rs7183877, indicating a strong linkage to the phenotypic expression of pigmentation traits under selective pressure.
title: A genomic dating tool resolves the origins of ancient Eurasian genomes

finding: The study confirmed that carriers of the A-allele of the SELENOS -105G/A promoter polymorphism (rs28665122) experienced increased ER stress and production of inflammatory cytokines. This was related to the context of SARS-CoV-2 down-regulating the expression of SELENOF, SELENOM, SELENOK, and SELENOS, indicating that this SNP may contribute to an increased risk of cytokine storm in susceptible individuals during COVID-19.
title: SARS-CoV-2 suppresses mRNA expression of selenoproteins associated with ferroptosis, ER stress and DNA synthesis

finding: rs1806845 was noted for its positive correlation with breast cancer and prostate cancer susceptibility, reflected in new associations across cancers.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs150393409 marked the onset-hastening haplotype 15AM1 and was associated with significant effects on HD onset, its missense variant suggesting a deleterious role in FAN1 function.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs151322829 defined modifier haplotype 15AM3, associated with hastened onset of HD, and linked to a predicted deleterious effect on FAN1 function.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs35811129 corresponded with haplotype 15AM2, showing an increased gene expression association leading to delayed onset.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs2033939 located at 15q14 demonstrated a highly significant association with cortical thickness (CTh) and cortical volume (CV), with p-values of 1.17×10^-73 and 4.34×10^-133 respectively. This finding highlighted its relevance in the postcentral (primary somatosensory) cortex.
title: Genetic Determinants of Cortical Structure (Thickness, Surface Area and Volumes) among Disease Free Adults in the CHARGE Consortium

finding: The SNP rs1080066, also located at 15q14, showed a significant association with cortical surface area (CSA), achieving a p-value of 8.45×10^-109. This association was observed in the precentral (primary motor) cortex.
title: Genetic Determinants of Cortical Structure (Thickness, Surface Area and Volumes) among Disease Free Adults in the CHARGE Consortium

finding: The variant rs3742971 was identified as a cis-eQTL negatively associated with the expression of the gene ADAL in D1, D2, D1/D2 medium spiny neurons, and FS interneurons. This gene exhibited lower expression in individuals with AUD. The decreased levels of ADAL align with findings in mice showing that elevated Adal levels correspond with low alcohol preference, indicating its relevance in AUD risk.
title: Integrated Single-Cell Multiomic Profiling of Caudate Nucleus Suggests Key Mechanisms in Alcohol Use Disorder

finding: The rs1426654 SNP, a G -> A substitution, was strongly associated with skin pigmentation in Eurasian populations. Despite previous assumptions that the derived A allele was rare in Africa, recent evidence indicated it was present at significant frequencies in East Africa. Furthermore, East African populations exhibited the same extended haplotype as those in Eurasia, suggesting a reintroduction of the mutation into Africa after the out-of-Africa migration. Analyses aimed to determine whether the sweep signature indicated a hard sweep or one from standing variation, suggesting complex population dynamics surrounding this SNP.
title: Selective sweeps under dominance and inbreeding

finding: The SNP rs11071014 was identified in the study as having a significant association with the regulation of apoptosis-related genes, particularly in the context of p53 and NOTCH signaling pathways. Given that the study provided insights into the transcriptional control mechanisms influenced by p53, this finding offered new molecular insights linking this SNP to anti-cancer therapeutic strategies.
title: Shared gene targets of the ATF4 and p53 transcriptional networks

finding: The study indicated that variations at the SNP rs11070904 were associated with altered Wnt signaling pathways, which influenced the metabolism and survival of B cells. This finding was pivotal in linking specific genetic variants to the modulation of β-catenin accumulation, acting as a regulatory factor in B cell differentiation and survival, particularly in the context of B cell malignancies.
title: Accumulation of the GSK3 target protein β-catenin is lethal for B cell precursors and malignant B cells

finding: The Ap3s2 gene variant rs2028299 was associated with type 2 diabetes, highlighting its contribution to diabetes-related metabolic disorders.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of differentially expressed genes in non alcoholic fatty liver disease using next generation sequencing data

finding: This SNP was associated with both breast and prostate cancers and also met criteria for novel associations for these cancer types.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: For SNP rs111834387, a significant interaction was observed with the predicted mRNA expression levels of TET2, which modulated the POE on cg21252175. The findings indicated that lower TET2 expression reduced the contrast in methylation levels between heterozygous groups.
title: Lifestyle and Genetic Factors Modify Parent-of-Origin Effects on the Human Methylome

finding: SNP rs7497304 was recovered by the IHT method along with rs2677738, with a pairwise correlation of r3,4 = 0.49.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: SNP rs2677738 was identified by the IHT method together with rs7497304, exhibiting a pairwise correlation of r3,4 = 0.49.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The SNP rs12902602 was associated with obesity and reached genome-wide significance in a study involving 241,258 individuals. This finding specifically highlighted the gene CHRNB4 and its interaction with smoking status, indicating that the effect of this SNP on obesity could be modified by smoking.
title: A unified method for rare variant analysis of gene-environment interactions

finding: The SNP rs35811129 was associated with the estimated length of long TCF4 alleles, indicating its role in modulating TCF4 repeat instability in blood cells. This association was significant (p=1.3×10^-5) and strengthened with further analyses, suggesting that this SNP contributed to the understanding of repeat expansions associated with age and potentially Huntington's disease.
title: Insights into the causes and consequences of DNA repeat expansions from 700,000 biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs17514846 within the FURIN locus showed association as both an eQTL and sQTL, reinforcing GWAS annotations.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: As a regulatory region variant for ISG20, this SNP was part of the study's findings regarding height associations that were previously unrecognized.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: SNP rs11071026 was linked to spatiotemporal pH heterogeneity and its influence on cancer progression and therapeutic resistance, as reported by Korenchan and Flavell (2019). This indicates the SNP's significance in the context of pHi changes that affect cancer cell behavior.
title: Single-cell intracellular pH measurements reveal cell-cycle linked pH dynamics

finding: Research indicated that SNP rs11071008 played a pivotal role in the metastasis of ovarian cancer by affecting cancer stem cells and their interaction with mechanical forces. This highlighted the importance of mechanical forces in metastatic processes and the biological implications associated with cancer stem cells.
title: Application of sequential cyclic compression on cancer cells in a flexible microdevice

finding: The non-synonymous polymorphism rs16969968 (D398N) in the gene <italic>Chrna5</italic> was found to be associated with nicotine dependence, schizophrenia, and cognitive impairment in humans. Specifically, nicotinic receptors containing the D398N polymorphism exhibited partial loss of function due to alterations in receptor desensitization, calcium permeability, or membrane trafficking.
title: Chrna5 and lynx prototoxins identify acetylcholine super-responder subplate neurons

finding: The rs16969968 SNP located in CHRNA5 was confirmed to have a causal effect on lower offspring birthweight specifically among participants whose mothers smoked during pregnancy. Each additional smoking-increasing allele was associated with a 0.018 kg reduction in birthweight (95% CI: -0.026, -0.009), while there was no significant association in the maternal non-smoking stratum (P-value = 0.004 for interaction). This finding replicated established results and highlighted the importance of maternal smoking during pregnancy on offspring birthweight.
title: Proxy gene-by-environment Mendelian randomization study confirms a causal effect of maternal smoking on offspring birthweight, but little evidence of long-term influences on offspring health

finding: The SNP rs2652822 in the human LACTB gene was associated with plasma succinylcarnitine levels in a large population-based European cohort, with a highly significant p-value of 7×10⁻²⁷. This finding implies a genetic correlation between LACTB alleles and succinylcarnitine metabolism, which was evidenced by the identification of a relationship between Lactb mRNA expression levels and body mass index, with an effect size reflected by a p-value of 1.19×10⁻⁸.
title: High Throughput Computational Mouse Genetic Analysis

finding: Variant rs8025239 was discovered during the training fold of the MOSTest application, which assessed its association with cortical area through a mass univariate map of association statistics. This variant successfully replicated when the PolyVertex Score (PVS) method was applied, yielding significant correlation in test data, indicating its relevance in the context of brain MRI morphology.
title: Generalization of Cortical MOSTest Genome-Wide Associations Within and Across Samples

finding: The SNP rs17293632 was identified to affect enhancer activity in endothelial cells (ECs). Furthermore, its deletion using CRISPR resulted in a significant reduction of SMAD3 expression in human aortic endothelial cells (HAECs), although there was no eQTL detected in HAECs.
title: Functional non-coding SNPs in human endothelial cells fine-map vascular trait associations

finding: The common missense SNP rs3817428 in ACAN showed strong associations with height variance. Coupled with VNTR variations, it contributed to explaining 0.33% of height variance in Europeans.
title: Protein-coding repeat polymorphisms strongly shape diverse human phenotypes

finding: SNP rs34949187 was reported as having potentially deleterious effects on ACAN function, associating it with additional genetic impacts on height and supporting the model of combined effects with the VNTR.
title: Protein-coding repeat polymorphisms strongly shape diverse human phenotypes

finding: The ASCA-SNP rs111261603 was associated with significant disruption in the integrity of certain RNMs, indicating its impact on pluripotency state variations among hiPSC lines.
title: Unsupervised Machine Learning Identifies Chromatin Accessibility Regulatory Networks that Define Cell State Transitions in Pluripotency

finding: This SNP was associated with the pars opercularis area within 15q14 and demonstrated a very strong signal in the GWAS for regional analysis (GWAS<italic>r</italic>) with a p-value of 2.2e-60 and explained 0.83% of the variance. It highlighted how global brain measures provide additional insights for detecting genetic loci affecting brain structure.
title: Larger cerebral cortex is genetically correlated with greater frontal area and dorsal thickness

finding: The A allele of the regulatory-SNP rs1979905 was associated with significantly higher expression of CHRNA5 (t=27.87, p=5.94*10^-124). Furthermore, the A allele was linked to significantly reduced β-amyloid load in the prefrontal cortex (t=-2.551, p=0.011), indicating a neuroprotective role in Alzheimer’s disease.
title: CHRNA5 links chandelier cells to protection against amyloid pathology in human aging and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The missense SNP rs16969968 A allele was found to impair the function/trafficking of nicotinic α5-containing receptors. Individuals homozygous for this A allele exhibited significantly lower proportions of chandelier cells with increasing β-amyloid load (interaction term t=-2.799, p=0.005), suggesting greater vulnerability to neurodegeneration.
title: CHRNA5 links chandelier cells to protection against amyloid pathology in human aging and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs11639051 displayed a meta-P-value of 1.93 × 10^-58, mapping to the PCSK6 locus. This SNP was part of previously recognized associations with cytokine levels.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs6598475, associated with the PCSK6 gene, showed a meta-P-value of 2.63 × 10^-17 and was recognized for its contribution to the cytokine network.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: SNP rs17293632 (C > T) served as a Ref-ASB for 25 different transcription factors. It was associated with Crohn's disease and located in the SMAD3 intron, overlapping an eQTL targeting SMAD3, AAGAB, and PIAS1 genes. Additionally, an association was noted with SMAD3 variants and increased risks of repeated surgery and shorter relapse times in Crohn's disease patients.
title: Landscape of allele-specific transcription factor binding in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs4702, located in the 3' UTR of the FURIN gene, was identified as influencing susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection. Specifically, the allele conversion from AA to GG resulted in decreased FURIN expression, which correlated with reduced SARS-CoV-2 infection in both alveolospheres and neurons. This finding highlighted the role of common genetic variation in modulating the host response to SARS-CoV-2, suggesting that individuals with the GG genotype may have a lower risk of severe disease due to reduced viral entry facilitated by lower FURIN levels.
title: Common genetic variation in humans impacts in vitro susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: The SNP rs11070948 was associated with high expression levels of Stearoyl-CoA Desaturase (SCD) in various cancer types, including acute myeloid leukaemia (AML). This finding indicated that genetic variants affecting SCD expression could impact vulnerability to SCD inhibition therapy, which had been identified as a potential treatment strategy for AML.
title: SCD inhibition eradicates AML displaying high de novo fatty acid desaturation and synergizes with chemotherapy

finding: The index SNP rs11635336 was linked to increased expression of L1 subfamilies when associated with the genes IL16 and STARD5. GSEA indicated significant upregulation of the L1 family among other TE families as a result of this SNP's genotype.
title: An eQTL-based Approach Reveals Candidate L1 Transcriptional Regulators in Lymphoblastoid Cells

finding: The SNP rs937213 at the 15q15.1 risk locus was one of the top eQTLs for the HiChIP target gene SRP14, indicating its involvement in endometrial cancer susceptibility.
title: Analysis of promoter-associated chromatin interactions reveals biologically relevant candidate target genes at endometrial cancer risk loci

finding: The SNP rs12914385 demonstrated a strong association with lung cancer with a p-value of 1.887 x 10^-15 in the GENEVA study. It was identified as the top signal in the chromosome 15q25.1 locus. Furthermore, it also showed a significant association with dichotomized smoking pack-years (p=1.364 x 10^-6), indicating its relevance to both lung cancer risk and smoking exposure metrics.
title: Efficient Estimation of Indirect Effects in Case-Control Studies Using a Unified Likelihood Framework

finding: The SNP rs261338, located within the LIPC gene, was identified as being associated with higher cholesterol content in medium-sized HDLs. This association was contextually related to cholesterol efflux capacity, with a reported beta value of 0.094 (95% CI: 0.013; 0.18) indicating the impact of this genetic variant on HDL functionality.
title: High-density lipoprotein characteristics and coronary heart disease: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The variant rs1493699 emerged as a sc-caQTL that reduced accessibility of its master region while increasing accessibility in a dependent region in microglia (MG) and was not identified as a sc-eQTL for PEAK1 in MG.
title: Integrative single cell multiomics analysis of human retina indicates a role for hierarchical transcription factors collaboration in genetic effects on gene regulation

finding: The index SNP rs62013139 was associated with allele-specific GOM in multiple myeloma, displaying strong ASM and hypermethylation of the REF allele in cancer samples compared to normal B cells.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: SNP rs5742915, a missense variant (Phe645Leu) in gene PML, was fine-mapped for the FEV1-FVC ratio (PIP = 0.858), pulse rate (PIP = 1.000), and total protein level (PIP = 0.987). This variant had been associated with multiple quantitative biomarkers of polygenic traits such as birth weight, height, appendicular lean mass, and age at menarche, suggesting its pleiotropic effects on the development and metabolism among vital organs.
title: SparsePro: an efficient genome-wide fine-mapping method integrating summary statistics and functional annotations

finding: Synonymous in <italic>LARP6</italic>, this SNP was found to be an eQTL impacting related cognitive functions and was associated with glucose levels.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: This synonymous variant in <italic>LARP6</italic> showed significant association with cognitive abilities and gene expression modulation in cerebellar regions.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: Identified as an eQTL, this variant in <italic>THAP10</italic>/intronic <italic>LRRC49</italic> showed significance in relation to cognitive functions.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The SNP rs2250072 was associated with the SLC24A5 gene, a major driver of variation in skin pigmentation that demonstrated positive selection in European populations.
title: A fast linkage disequilibrium-based statistical test for Genome-Wide Epistatic Selection Scans in structured populations

finding: The SNP rs1834640 was involved in significant linkage disequilibrium with the SLC24A5 gene in analyses focusing on Central South Asian populations, suggesting local coselection or epistatic selection.
title: A fast linkage disequilibrium-based statistical test for Genome-Wide Epistatic Selection Scans in structured populations

finding: The SNP rs2021013 was linked with the molecular mechanisms that contribute to the anti-tumor activity of cannabinoids on gliomas, specifically noting its involvement in oxidative stress pathways that affect tumor behavior and treatment outcomes in glioblastoma.
title: Discovery of Novel Small Molecule CB2 Agonist for the Treatment of Glioblastoma Tumors

finding: The finding related to SNP rs11070893 was significant in the context of nerve interactions and pancreatic cancer, as it was associated with new insights into the relationship between nerves and pancreatic cancer progression. This association was documented in the study of Gasparini et al., highlighting the critical role of nerve fibers in the pathology of pancreatic cancer.
title: Cancer-mediated Axonal Guidance of Sensory Neurons in a Microelectrode-based Innervation MPS

finding: In the context of autism (AUT), rs1380986 located on chromosome 22 had a MAF of 0.0006, an Info score of 0.498, and a p-value of 8.01 * 10<sup>-15</sup>. This finding exceeded the stringent threshold, providing a new signal associated with autism.
title: DISTMIX2: robust imputation of summary statistics for cosmopolitan cohorts using a large and diverse reference panel

finding: The missense variant rs113298164 in LIPC (p.Thr405Met) was associated with 11 traits related to cholesterols, fatty acids, apolipoproteins, and cholines, indicating significant influence on lipid metabolism.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: The SNP rs17514846 was associated with differential Fes protein levels, where higher levels of Fes predicted increased cancer incidence rates and mortality risk. Specifically, it was found that individuals without cancer at baseline showed a hazard ratio (HR) of 1.03 (1.01 – 1.05, p=0.01) for cancer incidence and an HR of 1.06 (1.01 – 1.11, p=0.03) for risk of death in a cohort of over 400,000 individuals from the UK Biobank. This finding suggested that reduced Fes protein expression, as influenced by the rs17514846 SNP, correlated with lower cancer incidence.
title: Fes-deficient macrophages enhance CD8+ T cell priming and tumour control through increased proinflammatory cytokine production and presentation

finding: The SNP rs372754794 was significantly associated with variation in the L:M cone ratio, exhibiting a strong connection with the NR2F2 gene, which is involved in retinoic acid signaling. The minor (G) allele was linked to a reduced L:M ratio, predominantly appearing in African American subjects, indicating its relevance in cone subtype specification during retinal development.
title: Temporal regulation of green and red cone specification in human retinas and retinal organoids

finding: SNP rs381001 was associated with moldability, where individuals with the AC allele showed medium moldability scores, indicating its role in this culinary quality.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: The SNP provided highly significant p-values for association with four dyslexia traits, making it the strongest evidence for association across all analyses, demonstrating substantial impact on reading and spelling phenotypes.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: This variant located 16.1 kb downstream of CYP19A1 was identified to potentially disrupt the binding of the TF PRDM1, indicating a significant regulatory role relating to dyslexia risk.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: This rare allele was significantly associated with decreased performance in working ability and intelligence quotient adjusted reading assessments, highlighting its potential impact on dyslexia risk.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: rs1426654 was identified as a large-effect variant in the SCL24A5 gene, which significantly contributed to the genetic variance for skin pigmentation traits, particularly in European population samples.
title: Interpreting SNP heritability in admixed populations

finding: The SNP rs1426654 at the SLC24A5 locus associated with skin pigmentation was selected for even earlier than rs35395, reaching near fixation around 3,500 years ago.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The SNP rs16969968 was found to be associated with smoking-related outcomes, where carriers of the minor allele reported reduced cravings following smoking a cigarette (b=-2.46, p=0.04) and exhibited lower inhalation volumes both per cigarette (b=-0.24, p=0.01) and per puff (b=-0.18, p=0.02). These findings aligned with earlier observations indicating that this variant is positively associated with nicotine dependence.
title: Exploration of the role of CHRNA5-A3-B4 genotype in smoking behaviours

finding: The SNP rs1051730 showed a significant positive association with nicotine dependence and smoking intensity in previous studies. In the current study, minor allele carriers experienced a reduction in smoking cravings post-cigarette and inhaled less smoke, affirming its role in influencing smoking behavior and possibly nicotine intake mechanisms.
title: Exploration of the role of CHRNA5-A3-B4 genotype in smoking behaviours

finding: The GLCE variant rs3865014 (A>G) exhibited associations with BMI, blood hemoglobin, hypertension, and cerebrovascular events, implicating its relevance to kidney and systemic health.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs12913832 within the HERC2 gene was identified as a significant modifier of human pigmentation, influencing the chromatin-loop formation with a long-range enhancer that interacts with the OCA2 promoter. This finding provided insight into the genetic mechanisms driving variations in skin pigmentation, which is also related to the melanin synthesis pathways discussed in the context of melanocytes and their functions.
title: Enhanced MC1R-signalling and pH modulation facilitate melanogenesis within late endosomes of BLOC-1-deficient melanocytes

finding: The SNP rs2470890 was recognized for its elevated allele frequency in all non-African populations, with the specific variant being found at a frequency of 12.5% in Papuans.
title: Archaic introgression and variation in pharmacogenes and implications for local adaptation

finding: The SNP rs1440802 at locus 15q14 was significantly associated with functional connectivity (FC) between the precentral gyrus and the dorsal pars opercularis (Prec↔F3opd) as well as between the precentral gyrus and the Rolandic sulcus (PrecR↔RolS). Both connections were linked to phonological and semantic language processing. The minor allele of rs1440802 was found to enhance these FCs, highlighting its role in language phonology and semantic processing.
title: The genetic architecture of language functional connectivity

finding: The SNP rs11071008 was found to play a significant role in the context of ovarian cancer metastasis, reflecting the complex interaction between cancer stem cells and mechanical forces, suggesting its involvement in the mechanobiological processes influencing ovarian cancer progression.
title: Application of sequential cyclic compression on cancer cells in a flexible microdevice

finding: The variant rs7350789 was predicted to increase binding affinity for NKX2-5 and was validated through EMSA. However, due to low binding affinity in the reference sequence, quantification of the  change was not possible.
title: Disease-Associated Non-Coding Variants Alter NKX2-5 DNA-Binding Affinity

finding: The SNP rs539846 was identified as a causal variant for chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) risk by FCNsignal, confirming the tool's effectiveness in finding disease-associated SNPs.
title: Base-resolution prediction of transcription factor binding signals by a deep learning framework

finding: The SNP rs1478605, located in the 5' untranslated region of the THBS1 gene, was associated with the development and progression of gastric cancer, indicating its potential role as a biomarker for the disease.
title: Investigation of the underlying hub genes and molexular pathogensis in gastric cancer by integrated bioinformatic analyses

finding: The SNP rs11071037 was connected to the activity of AP-1 transcription factors. This connection was relevant in the context of immune responses in cancer, suggesting a role in the modulation of cell proliferation related to benzidine exposure.
title: Benzidine Induces Proliferation of UMUC3 Bladder Cancer Cells Through Activation of ERK5 Pathway

finding: The SNP rs1465252689 (G39V) resulted in a deleterious amino acid change from Glycine to Valine at position 39, contributing to the disease mechanism in Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs1271001430 (I46S) caused a damaging transformation of Isoleucine to Serine at position 46, indicating its potential role in the pathology of Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs1205294920 (G97C) led to a harmful alteration from Glycine to Cysteine at position 97, highlighting its significance as a contributor to Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs756333430 (A122T) was identified to cause a change from Alanine to Threonine at position 122, which adversely affected protein function related to Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs766657715 (A122E) resulted in a substitution of Alanine with Glutamic Acid at position 122, indicating its damaging role in the context of Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs1257538190 (T172I) was found to change Threonine to Isoleucine at position 172, contributing to the detrimental effects observed in Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs1404589314 (R178C) demonstrated a harmful amino acid change from Arginine to Cysteine at position 178, therefore emerging as a significant finding for Retinitis Pigmentosa pathology.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs1329563873 (R178H) produced an alteration from Arginine to Histidine at position 178, further linking it to the mechanisms involved in Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs1303775777 (Y186C) showed a change from Tyrosine to Cysteine at position 186, indicating its potential involvement in the development of Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs200797531 (V198G) produced a transformation from Valine to Glycine at position 198, supporting its contribution to the disease mechanism in Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs745664361 (L210P) was associated with a damaging change from Leucine to Proline at position 210, potentially important for the pathology of Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs978588480 (P243R) resulted in a shift from Proline to Arginine at position 243, highlighting its relevance in Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs1429951757 (G268R) showed a deleterious change from Glycine to Arginine at position 268, marking its significance in the context of Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs775992590 (G271S) indicated a transition from Glycine to Serine at position 271, contributing to the harmful effects seen in Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs756712426 (P304H) led to a change from Proline to Histidine at position 304, underlining its implications in Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: The SNP rs750565047 (I327T) was observed to change Isoleucine to Threonine at position 327, suggesting its involvement in the pathogenicity of Retinitis Pigmentosa.
title: In silico analysis of IDH3A gene revealed Novel mutations associated with Retinitis Pigmentosa

finding: This missense variant in the FBN1 gene was identified in a GWAS in Peru, showing the largest effect size for common height-associated variants, with each copy of the minor allele reducing height by 2.2 cm. It exhibited subtle evidence of positive selection in the Peruvian population.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The SNP rs11070923 was identified among candidates associated with resistance in non-small cell lung cancer, highlighting its potential role in acquired resistance to EGFR-tyrosine kinase inhibitors.
title: Resistance patterns in drug-adapted cancer cell lines reflect complex evolution in clinical tumors

finding: The SNP rs11070984 was found to be linked to the presence of cancer testis antigens (CTAs), specifically PAGE5 and GAGE2A, which were identified as mediators of chemoresistance in SCLC. This indicated a potential avenue for targeted therapy in this aggressive cancer type.
title: Single Cell lineage Tracing Identifies Cancer Testis Antigens as Mediators of Chemoresistance in Small Cell Lung Cancer

finding: The SNP rs12913832 was identified as a crucial intronic variant in the HERC2 gene regulating OCA2 expression, leading to blue eye color. It exhibited high penetrance for blue eyes when homozygous for GG.
title: A general model for two-locus assortative mating analysis and prediction

finding: The aQTL rs11547207 was found to colocalize with a cis-eQTL for the CIB2 gene in the Adrenal Gland. This association contributes to understanding the potential mechanisms of trans-acting genetic effects involving HDAC8 and its regulatory networks.
title: Identifying Genetic Regulatory Variants that Affect Transcription Factor Activity

finding: This SNP was tagged by the L1 insertion in the NEDD4 gene (L1-NEDD4), which associated with keloid disease. It was a lead variant in the keloid GWAS in the Japanese population, showing strong linkage disequilibrium (R² = 0.85).
title: Mobile elements in human population-specific genome and phenotype divergence

finding: This SNP was tagged by the L1-NEDD4 insertion and was previously associated with keloid severity in the Japanese population. It also showed a strong linkage disequilibrium (R² = 0.91) and was linked to Dupuytren’s disease and fasciitis. This position highlighted a potential generalizable effect on diseases characterized by fibroblast inflammation.
title: Mobile elements in human population-specific genome and phenotype divergence

finding: This SNP was associated with Dupuytren's disease and fasciitis in the GWAS, showing a high linkage disequilibrium (R² = 0.86) with the L1-NEDD4 insertion, linking it to potential fibroblast inflammation disease pathways.
title: Mobile elements in human population-specific genome and phenotype divergence

finding: The SNP rs11070926 was associated with enhanced Wnt/β-Catenin signaling pathways in liver cancer, which was a crucial original finding connecting genetic predisposition to liver cancer susceptibility. This SNP's influence was documented in the context of cancer pathogenesis, illustrating its relevance as a genetic marker for liver cancer.
title: Detection of reproducible liver cancer specific ligand-receptor signaling in blood

finding: The SNP rs17293632 altered the binding dynamics of FOSL1, FOSL2, and BATF, suggesting its relevance for ankylosing spondylitis (AS), Crohn's disease (CD), multiple sclerosis (MS), psoriatic arthritis (PS), rheumatoid arthritis (RA), and ulcerative colitis (UC) in modulating Th17 cell activities.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: The proxy variant rs11633883 exhibited significantly increased expression for the derived haplotype compared to the ancestral haplotype in a region showing a phenotypic effect.
title: Three linked opposing regulatory variants under selection associate with IVD

finding: The 5-bp indel rs66791338 was identified as reducing luciferase expression when the derived deletion allele was converted to the ancestral insertion, indicating its regulatory potential.
title: Three linked opposing regulatory variants under selection associate with IVD

finding: The variant rs111540938, designated as “α”, demonstrated stronger signals of allelic skew and drove overexpression of the reporter gene in MPRA, indicating its regulatory role.
title: Three linked opposing regulatory variants under selection associate with IVD

finding: The variant rs10851395, known as “β”, also showed strong regulatory activity with increased expression in its ancestral form compared to the derived allele.
title: Three linked opposing regulatory variants under selection associate with IVD

finding: The variant rs4924532 was associated with eGFR (P = 2.96 × 10^-40) and linked to INO80 as the target gene in kidney tubule cells, highlighting its relevance to kidney function studies.
title: Genetic Studies Highlight the Role of TET2 and INO80 in DNA Damage Response and Kidney Disease Pathogenesis

finding: The study discovered that alterations in the cis-regulatory mechanisms of the gene ADAM10 were linked to Alzheimer’s disease (AD). This particular SNP, rs602602, which was in proximity to the fine-mapped lead ADAM10 SNP and within its strong linkage disequilibrium (LD) block, was shown to potentially disrupt the DNA-binding motif. These disruptions were hypothesized to lead to decreased transcription factor (TF) binding activity in AD patients compared to controls, indicating its role in AD pathology.
title: Single-nucleus multi-omics identifies shared and distinct pathways in Pick’s and Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP was identified as newly FDR significant through Flexible cFDR, leveraging functional genomic data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP rs121907970 (R247W) led to a substitution of Arginine with Tryptophan at position 247 of the HEXA protein. The analysis through Project Hope and Chimera Softwares indicated that this change adversely affected the structural integrity of the protein.
title: Thirty two novel nsSNPs May effect on HEXA protein Leading to Tay-Sachs disease (TSD) Using a Computational Approach

finding: For SNP rs121907972 (R170W), the amino acid at position 170 changed from Arginine to Tryptophan. The impact of this mutation on the HEXA protein's 3D structure was assessed using Project Hope and Chimera Softwares, confirming its potentially damaging effects.
title: Thirty two novel nsSNPs May effect on HEXA protein Leading to Tay-Sachs disease (TSD) Using a Computational Approach

finding: The SNP rs28941770 (R178W) resulted in the conversion of Arginine to Tryptophan at amino acid position 178 of the HEXA protein, with evaluations conducted via Project Hope and Chimera Softwares demonstrating a detrimental impact on the protein's structural configuration.
title: Thirty two novel nsSNPs May effect on HEXA protein Leading to Tay-Sachs disease (TSD) Using a Computational Approach

finding: The study found that the type 2 diabetes associated variant rs528350911 disrupted a GATA motif within the enhancer located 664 kb from the ONECUT1 promoter. The introduction of this risk variant into human pluripotent stem cells (hPSCs) led to significantly reduced binding of key pancreatic transcription factors GATA4, GATA6, and FOXA2 and a slight decrease in ONECUT1 transcription. This finding indicated a causal role for rs528350911 in metabolic disease, as mutations in ONECUT1 are implicated in neonatal diabetes and pancreatic hypoplasia.
title: CRISPR Screening Uncovers a Long-Range Enhancer for ONECUT1 in Pancreatic Differentiation and Links a Diabetes Risk Variant

finding: The SNP rs12914385 demonstrated a strong association with lung cancer in the GENEVA study with a p-value of 1.887×10^-15. This SNP was the top signal in the chromosome 15q25.1 locus. Furthermore, it also showed a significant association with the dichotomized smoking pack-years variable, with a p-value of 1.364×10^-6. Mediation analysis indicated that the effect of rs12914385 on lung cancer risk was predominantly a direct effect, but there was evidence of a modest indirect effect through smoking pack-years, indicating its substantial influence on the lung cancer phenotype.
title: Efficient Estimation of Indirect Effects in Case-Control Studies Using a Unified Likelihood Framework

finding: The rs12915901 variant at ALDH1A2 was identified as a key target variant influencing genetic risk for osteoarthritis, thus contributing to the understanding of this condition.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The rs12913832 SNP in the HERC2 gene contributed to modulation of human pigmentation by affecting chromatin-loop formation between a long-range enhancer and the OCA2 promoter. This SNP was associated with variation in pigmentation, thereby linking genetic factors to melanocyte function and survival.
title: CRTC3 is a coincidence detector for cAMP and growth factor signals in melanocytes and melanoma

finding: The SNP rs1452984345 was identified in a patient-derived induced pluripotent stem cell (iPSC) line with a spondylothoracic dysostosis (STD) diagnosis. It was a compound heterozygous loss-of-function mutation in the gene <italic>MESP2</italic>, corresponding to a deletion resulting in a premature stop codon at position 118. This mutation played a critical role in the analysis of human somitogenesis and its association with diseases affecting axial skeletogenesis.
title: Modeling the Human Segmentation Clock with Pluripotent Stem Cells

finding: The SNP rs71647808 was also found in the same STD patient-derived iPSC line, indicating another compound heterozygous loss-of-function mutation in <italic>MESP2</italic>, specifically a transition mutation resulting in a nonsense mutation at amino acid position 103.
