Similar to rs1452984345, this finding provided insights into the mechanisms of spondylothoracic dysostosis and underscored the significance of <italic>MESP2</italic> in somitogenesis.
title: Modeling the Human Segmentation Clock with Pluripotent Stem Cells

finding: The SNP rs2247233 was identified as one of the top GWAS SNPs associated with schizophrenia (SCZ) that resided within the eRNA41216 locus. This eRNA was characterized within a super-enhancer, and fine-mapping determined rs2247233 as significant in explaining the GWAS results for the associated risk.
title: Transcribed enhancers in the human brain identify novel disease risk mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs11071010 was associated with lung-seeking metastases; it was identified as a significant genetic marker in the progression of lung-related cancers as discussed in the research by Stella et al. (2019). This finding provided insights into how genetic variations could influence tumorigenesis and subsequently affect treatment response.
title: Crystal ribcage: a platform for probing real-time lung function at cellular resolution in health and disease

finding: This SNP was linked to asymmetries of connectivity in the rolandic operculum and supramarginal gyrus, with a z-score of 7.11.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: In high LD with rs28520337, this SNP has been associated with cortical surface area.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: SNP rs4238361 was identified to influence the gene expression of USP47 and two other genes (RP11-507B12.2 and RP11-259A24.1) as part of a risk prediction model for PD.
title: Establishing gene regulatory networks from Parkinson’s disease risk loci

finding: The frequency of the derived allele at rs1426654 in the SLC24A5 gene was estimated to be 1 in the Mokrin sample, also associated with skin depigmentation in Europeans, which correlates with a similar frequency observed in modern populations.
title: Kinship, acquired and inherited status, and population structure at the Early Bronze Age Mokrin necropolis in northern Serbia

finding: The frequency of the derived G allele at rs12913832 in the HERC2 gene was estimated to be 0.4498 in the Mokrin sample, showing its association with iris depigmentation. This frequency was comparable to that found in modern populations in Tuscany.
title: Kinship, acquired and inherited status, and population structure at the Early Bronze Age Mokrin necropolis in northern Serbia

finding: The variant rs261342 mapping to the LIPC gene region exhibited a large Cook's distance, indicating that it had a prominent influence on the analysis of AMD risk. It was noted to have previously inconsistent associations with AMD when compared to other variants.
title: Selecting causal risk factors from high-throughput experiments using multivariable Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs35346340 was linked to myocardial infarction and coronary artery disease and interacted with FURIN in both cardiac fibroblasts and myocytes. Its significant role in influencing heart failure pathways was revealed through expression profiling.
title: Dissecting Regulatory Non-Coding Heart Disease GWAS Loci with High-Resolution 3D Chromatin Interactions Reveals Causal Genes with Pathophysiological Relevance to Heart Failure

finding: The study highlighted the role of p53 in regulating the fate of neural progenitor cells during DNA damage responses. The finding is associated with the differentiation induction in neural stem cells following irradiation, as observed in the research by Konirova et al. (2019). This relates directly to the mechanisms of cell differentiation and responses to stressors like irradiation.
title: p53 drives premature neuronal differentiation in response to radiation-induced DNA damage during early neurogenesis

finding: The SNP rs2620381, situated in miR-627, showed a significant association with RA, with a p-value of 2.55×10^-3, suggesting its role in influencing the risk of developing RA.
title: MicroRNA variants and HLA-miRNA interactions are novel rheumatoid arthritis susceptibility factors

finding: The SNP rs11070927 was associated with AURKA mutations that induced early-onset severe hepatocarcinogenesis in a zebrafish model, showing that this genotype activates different pathways compared to the wild-type, emphasizing its role in liver cancer progression.
title: Prognostic significance of SOCS1 and SOCS3 tumor suppressors in hepatocellular carcinoma and its correlation to key oncogenic signaling pathways

finding: The rs2073711 (A/G) TIM was associated with the CILP gene, related to cartilage scaffolding. The findings suggested an increase in the frequency of risk alleles, possibly due to sedentary lifestyle changes, revealing the impact of environmental transitions on genetic selection.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: SNP rs7183877 (C/A), located within the HERC gene, was part of a significant haplotype associated with blue eye color in Caucasians. The findings suggested a selective trend towards the C allele, correlating with lighter pigmentation traits.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: Similar to rs7183877, rs8028689 (T/C) was associated with the haplotype linked to blue eyes and suggested selective pressures favoring lighter eye colors among certain populations.
title: A genomic dating tool for ancient genomes resolves the origins of hundreds of Eurasian genomes

finding: This SNP, associated with AS, Crohn's disease (CD), multiple sclerosis (MS), psoriasis (PS), rheumatoid arthritis (RA), and ulcerative colitis (UC), was found to occur within AP-1 motifs near SMAD3 and significantly altered the binding characteristics for FOSL1, FOSL2, and BATF.
title: The AP-1 factors FOSL1 and FOSL2 co-regulate human Th17 responses

finding: The variant rs3742971 was found to be negatively associated with the expression of the gene ADAL in D1 MSNs, D2 MSNs, D1/D2 MSNs, and fast-spiking interneurons. Lower expression of ADAL was observed in individuals with AUD, indicating that ADAL may play a significant role in the development of AUD, given previous findings that elevated Adal levels in mice contribute to low alcohol preference.
title: Integrated Single-Cell Multiomic Profiling of Caudate Nucleus Suggests Key Mechanisms in Alcohol Use Disorder

finding: The SNP rs3826007-T was associated with a decreased count of flow-sorted monocytes, with associated GWAS p-values less than 5×10^-83. It demonstrated a specific association with the selective depletion of CD16+ monocytes and was linked to a deleterious missense change in BCL2A1, likely resulting in reduced survival of this cell type, which has implications for primary sclerosing cholangitis risk (GWAS p=1×10^-6).
title: Identifying genetic variants that influence the abundance of cell states in single-cell data

finding: The rs1802376 variant was significantly associated with the strength of response in both the R-NAc (P = 0.0028) and L-NAc (P = 0.0099). It mediates a nonsynonymous change from aspartic acid to asparagine at amino acid position 466 in the SNX1 gene and is supported by improved association signals in the patient-only subsample.
title: Gene Set-Based Analysis of the Endosomal Sorting Processes Cargo Selection and Membrane Tubulation with Human Reward System Reactivity

finding: The rs16969968 SNP in the CHRNA3 gene was associated with cognition and suggested to mediate risk for developing Nicotine Dependence.
title: Ancient Migrations - The first complete genome assembly, annotation and variants of the Zoroastrian-Parsi community of India

finding: The rs1051730 SNP in the CHRNA5 gene was linked to cognition and was also implicated in mediating the risk for Nicotine Dependence.
title: Ancient Migrations - The first complete genome assembly, annotation and variants of the Zoroastrian-Parsi community of India

finding: The rs762551 SNP located in the CYP1A2 gene was found to be associated with leflunomide induced toxicity, which is relevant in the treatment of Rheumatoid Arthritis.
title: Ancient Migrations - The first complete genome assembly, annotation and variants of the Zoroastrian-Parsi community of India

finding: This SNP was part of the Hirisplex-S system and showed a high correlation with skin and iris pigmentation specifically in individuals of south Asian ancestry.
title: How to choose sets of ancestry informative markers: A supervised feature selection approach

finding: The SNP rs15342, a T-to-C change located in the gene LRRK1, destroyed the strongest hexamer AATAAA, which was associated with an annotated poly(A) CS located 22 nucleotides downstream. This polymorphism was observed to prevent cleavage at the poly(A) CS immediately downstream, leading to the alternative usage of a more distal poly(A) CS, producing a transcript with an extended 3' UTR. The extended UTR was predicted to contain extensive binding sites for 16 miRNAs and RBP sites for 77 RBPs. The wildtype and variant transcripts were classified with a 98% and 1% probability of containing poly(A) CS, respectively, demonstrating the functional impact of the SNP.
title: Terminitor: Cleavage Site Prediction Using Deep Learning Models

finding: The SNP rs1496904 exhibited a POIROT p-value of 9.58 × 10⁻⁸, indicating near genome-wide significance in relation to quantitative anthropometric measures at birth. It was found 138kb from the transcription start site of the gene SEMA6D, which has been associated with traits such as arm fat mass and height, relevant to the study of infant growth.
title: POIROT: A powerful test for parent-of-origin effects in unrelated samples leveraging multiple phenotypes

finding: The rs6224 SNP was associated with schizophrenia at genome-wide levels of significance. Specifically, it was noted that the alleles increasing the odds of left-handedness also increased the risk of schizophrenia.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 48 common genetic variants associated with handedness

finding: The rs1802376 variant locus was associated with Alzheimer's disease and involved SNX1, which plays a role in retromer function relevant to LOAD.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The SNP rs11071010 was associated with lung-seeking metastases, as discussed in the study by Stella et al. (2019). This finding emphasized the role of genetic predispositions in the progression of lung cancer, particularly how certain genetic variants could influence the behavior of metastases within the lung microenvironment.
title: Crystal ribcage: a platform for probing real-time lung function at cellular resolution in health and disease

finding: The SNP rs4702 was identified in a study by Hou et al. (2018) as being associated with schizophrenia. The G allele of rs4702 was shown to specifically downregulate FURIN expression through the action of miR-338-3p, which in turn reduced the production of BDNF, a gene implicated in neurodevelopment and psychiatric disorders.
title: Large eQTL meta-analysis reveals differing patterns between cerebral cortical and cerebellar brain regions

finding: The SNP rs56077333 was associated with the CHRNA5-A3-B4 locus, which displayed significant vQTL effects on lung function related to smoking (p-value for vQTL < 1.1×10−14). A strong GEI effect was reported (p-value for GEI < 4.6×10−25), indicating that the influence of this genetic variant on lung function was significantly dependent on smoking status.
title: Genotype-by-environment interactions inferred from genetic effects on phenotypic variability in the UK Biobank

finding: The intronic variant rs12913832 displayed significant non-additive effects for blonde hair and skin colour, achieving P values of 2.87 × 10<sup>-56</sup> and 5.33 × 10<sup>-191</sup> respectively.
title: Analysis of genetic dominance in the UK Biobank

finding: The <italic>rs62015197</italic> SNP at the <italic>IDH2</italic> locus was associated with serum urate levels in response to allopurinol in gout.
title: Genomic dissection of 43 serum urate-associated loci provides multiple insights into molecular mechanisms of urate control
